1. Players agree to play to a number of points.
2. The players take turns being the Teleprompter.
2. The Teleprompter first chooses a number of receivers equal to half the number of players rounded down and describes a situation that the first player has caused through supernatural means. The situation is actually an enciphered message to the receiving players. The Teleprompter chooses a number of guesses: 1-3, inclusive, for the round.
3. A non-receiver is allowed to guess what the message means. Then, a receiver is allowed to guess. Then, a non-receiver is allowed to guess. The two groups alternate trying to figure out the message until either:
a. someone figures out the message or
b. everyone (save the originator of the message) has the opportunity to guess the predetermined number of times determined in step 2.
4. If 3a occurs and a receiver is the correct guesser, the Teleprompter and the receiver who guesses correctly each get a point. If a non-receiver is the correct guesser, then the non-receiver gets two points. If no-one guesses correctly, then the Teleprompter loses a point. It is not possible to have negative points.
5. The first player to the predetermined number of points wins. There can be ties.

118952.name: The Galaxy Corporate
118952.description:
The Galaxy Corporate is a world of trading and piracy for two to four players. Players amass influence by buying planets and trade outposts (or taking them by force) in their quest to become the largest corporation in the galaxy.

A unique economy system combines with a modular board to provide a different galaxy with every game. The laws of supply and demand force players to turn simple buying and selling into strategic economic weapons. Real weapons are also available in the form of ship upgrades and mercenary vessels to turn rivalries hostile.

Will you be a peaceful trading baron or bloodthirsty pirate? The choice is yours in the Galaxy Corporate.

118953.name: Olympicards
118953.description:
Olympicards has the player athletes compete in nine different events, with competition taking place via card play. Each sport has its own rules for playing cards, so sometimes you'll want to sit out an event to conserve your strength, while other times you'll push yourself to the limit to win the gold.

Each player starts the game with six cards, each card having a number and color. On a turn, you'll play one or two cards until you cannot – or don't want to – play any more cards. The first player to drop from the event receives more cards for next time, while whoever remains in the event until the end wins the gold medal (i.e. points).

Whoever has the most points after nine events wins!

118954.name: Old Century Pinball Golf
118954.description:
Old Century Pinball Golf Wood Wooden Table Top Pinball Machine (Game)

Swing down the fairways of the legendary courses as you relive the golden era of golf. Make a birdie or score the elusive hole-in-one -- but watch out for the sand traps and water hazards!

An heirloom quality coffee table game, Pinball Golf provides fun for everyone, from grandparents to grand kids.


Archival quality coffee table game



Classic look and feel reminiscent of the golden era of golf



Great addition to any golf collection



Authentic fun for the whole family


Features: hole progress track (golf tee pinhole track), convenient ball return, club shaped flipper, challenging hazards, a hole-in-one ramp

These wonderfully low-tech "Coffee Table Games" will provide hours of authentic fun. Powered only by imagination and enthusiasm, these high quality games and toys connect people, young and old, through play. Old Century Classics' unique designs and innovative interpretations of game and toy classics set a new standard for shared fun and laughter.

118955.name: Zombie! Run for Your Lives!
118955.description:
Boo! You and your friends are suddenly surrounded by hordes of very aggressive zombies. But do not fret as we have some good news – one of you will definitely get out alive. How can you become that lucky person? It's simple! As the old saw goes, you don't have to outrun the zombies; you just need to outrun your friends.

At the start of Zombie! Run for Your Lives! each player receives four cards from the deck; cards are one of two types: a zombie (which come in different varieties) or a potentially helpful item that can protect you from those aforementioned zombies. The different types of zombies and the items that affect them are color-coded and bear identical symbols for easy recognition.

On a turn, you draw a card from the deck, then play a card from your hand, sending a zombie after one of the other players or using an item to help yourself; if the item matches a zombie card in front of you, both cards are discarded. A player cannot have identical items or zombies in front of him. If you ever have five zombies in front of you, you've succumbed to the horde and become a zombie yourself. As a result, your mental abilities are extremely limited, which means that on your turn, you simply draw the top card and play it on a living player, getting revenge against whoever killed you or perhaps aiding the player you care for the most.

If, on the other hand, you collect five items in front of yourself, you've proved yourself invulnerable to zombies and instantly win!

118956.description:
Danny fights by filling up the arena with monster markers, which impede his opponent and improve his range.

Danny is one of the two protagonists from Iron Clown Studios "Sinner and Saint Remix", a gritty Manga-style comic.

This promo is available from Level 99 Games' convention booths, Iron Clown Studios convention booths, and via the Level 99 Games Store.
118956.name: BattleCON: Danny the Sinner Promo

118957.name: Dominion by Donald X. Vaccarino
118957.description:
User Summary

This is the iOS implementation of the popular board game Dominion by Donald X. Vaccarino.

In Dominion, each player starts with an identical, very small deck of cards. In the center of the table is a selection of other cards the players can "buy" as they can afford them. Through their selection of cards to buy, and how they play their hands as they draw them, the players construct their deck on the fly, striving for the most efficient path to the precious victory points by game end.

118958.name: Envoyer (Issue 83 - Sep 2003)
118958.description: This issue contains the earthdawn adventure "In die Tiefe", the adventure reached the 2nd place at the adventure competion.

118959.description:
Robert fights by accumulating tokens into his token pool over time. Each token gives him a powerful passive ability, and can be spent to grant a stronger single-use ability.

Robert is one of the main characters from Iron Clown Studios's "Sinner and Saint Remix", a gritty Manga-style comic.

This promo is available from Level 99 Games convention booths, Iron Clown Studios Convention Booths, and the Level 99 Games online store.
118959.name: BattleCON: Robert the Saint Promo

118960.name: Dungeon Logica
118960.description:
User Summary

Dungeon Logica is a puzzle adventure game, you can play with four different levels of difficulty.

The goal in Dungeon Logica is to find the legendary artifact, to do that you need to solve many puzzles along the way.

118961.name: Envoyer (Issue 84 - Oct 2003)
118961.description: This issue contains the Cthulhu adventure "Animus ex temore"

118962.name: Fortress Under Siege
118962.description:
"A conspiracy throws our kingdom into the most dangerous moment, which needs you and your army to shoulder the responsibility of safeguarding the kingdom. The powerful enemy already launches the attack, which leaves you no choice as you are the last hope of the kingdom."

Source: The Developer Website.

118963.description:
Claus & Wyndhal fight by bashing into enemies and sending them flying backwards. They possess high maneuverability, and are simple and straightforward characters to learn the game with.

Despite that the character's illustration contains two characters, the pair fight as a single unit and have only one presence on the board, unlike other 'team characters' such as Tatsumi & Juto.

Claus & Wyndhal are characters from an unfinished game that was planned by Level 99 Games, but ultimately dropped. It was entitled: "Wyndhal, Ancient of Autumn"

This promo card is available from Level 99 Games convention booths and the Level 99 Games online store.
118963.name: BattleCON: Claus & Wyndhal Promo

118964.description:
SOLO BALONCESTO is a two-player boardgame that recreates a real basketball match. Each player is one of the two teams facing-up coaches. Two teams with 10 players each, where you can choose your "starting lineup" on the court:


point guards
shooting guards
small forwards
power forwards
centers



Each player has 5 different skills: Passing - action points - play skill - height - scoring %.
You have full control of the whole team, which will allow you to perform any individual action with any player on the court. A joint action between two players like a screen or a "pick& roll", a team tactic like playing in the zone or a man-to-man defense, faithfully recreating what happens in a basketball game. Thanks to its mechanic, mixes a great realism in the actions with high simplicity. Players move one by one alternating between attacker and defender, not the entire team at once, making play faster. This makes the duration of a turn variable, so you play four quarters like in a real game but not a predetermined number of turns in each quarter.

Passes, rebounds, fouls, two-point shots, lay ups, three-pointers, dunks, freethrows, blocks, pick& roll, steals... any basketball action is possible in this game!
118964.name: Solo Baloncesto

118965.name: Envoyer (Issue 85 - Nov 2003)
118965.description: This issue contains the adventure "Bringt mir den Kopf von Elektra Jones" for Cyberpunk 2020. It also contains the handouts for the adventure of the last issue.

118966.name: Envoyer (Issue 86 - Dec 2003)
118966.description: This issue contains the Shadowrun adventure "Wipeout"

118967.name: Envoyer (Issue 87 - Jan 2004)
118967.description: This issue contains the second part of the shadowrun adventure "Wipeout"

118968.name: Envoyer (Issue 88 - Feb 2004)
118968.description: This issue contains the DSA adventure "Katzenwinter"

118969.name: Trippel
118969.description:
"The game with three pieces"

Old Swedish boardgame published by Brio. An abstract strategy game for 2-4 players, it's reminiscent of Halma while also featuring Checkers-like piece elimination using rock-paper-scissors mechanics. Everyone has three pieces: "Hunter", "eagle" and "snake". The goal is to move as many of your pieces as possible across the board. You can move your pieces left, right and forward, but never backwards, and diagonally only when jumping over other pieces. Hunters can kill eagles when jumping, eagles can kill snakes and snakes can kill hunters.

Because of the elimination mechanic, the winner is the player who reaches their target corner with the most pieces remaining (in case of a tie, the one who got there first). Unlike most similar games Trippel also supports a 3-player variant, though no specific rules for this are given.

Likely date of publication: 1950's-'60s.

118970.name: Envoyer (Issue 89 - Mar 2004)
118970.description: This issue contains the adventure "Der Graf" for Vampire.

118971.name: Envoyer (Issue 90 - Apr 2004)
118971.description: This issue contains an adventure for Modgard "Der Karawanenwürger" and the complete "light" rules for Lodland which can be seperated from the issue. (Lodland Light-Regelwerk)

118972.name: Envoyer (Issue 91 - May 2004)
118972.description: This issue contains the second part of the Midgard advneture "Der Karawanenwürger"

118973.name: Envoyer (Issue 92 - Jun 2004)
118973.description: This issue contains the adventure "Chroniken des ewigen Blutes" for Vampire

118974.name: Envoyer (Issue 93 - Jul 2004)
118974.description: This issue contains a KULT adventure "the angel's eyes"

118975.name: Envoyer (Issue 95 - Sep 2004)
118975.description: This issue contains the Cthulhu adventure "Ein Flüstern in der Nacht"

118976.name: Persona of the Undead Volume 1
118976.description:
From Introduction:

While undead creatures make exciting additions to fantasy adventures it is rather common to find the personalities or backgrounds of such monsters overlooked. In this edition of Persona Of The Undead one will find the background information for four different undead encounters. Use this information as a springboard for adventure hook ideas or merely tack the details on to a pre-existing undead in an adventure for a sense of added depth.

118977.name: Envoyer (Issue 96 - Oct 2004)
118977.description: This issue contains the adventure "Verrat im RDL" for LodlanD.

118978.name: Envoyer (Issue 97 - Nov 2004)
118978.description: Issue #97 with the first part of the Cthulhu adventure "N'gascar, das Ding aus der Tiefe"

118979.name: Secret Orders Vol. 1: Order of the Emerald Scarab
118979.description:
From Introduction:

Spread out amongst the crowded, urban environments where greater amounts of wealth and the higher degrees of intellect is passed about more openly and freely, there exists a secretive, sacred order of wizardry. Known as the Order Of The Emerald Scarab, it is said that this organization is comprised of the wealthiest and most influential of magical scholars and wizards.

118980.name: Secret Orders: The Keepers of Common Purity
118980.description:
From Introduction:

Borne from extreme prejudice, the Keepers Of Common Purity hold their concerns towards keeping their communities and surrounding regions from any element that might change or alter their “way of life”. Though now the Keepers hold interest over a wide variety of social and community elements, originally the order meant keeping the villages purely human and free from the infiltration of whole or half demi-human and humanoid residents.

118981.name: Envoyer (Issue 98 - Dec 2004)
118981.description: This issue contains the 2nd part of the Cthulhu adventure "N'gascar, das Ding aus der Tiefe". It also contains a LodlanD Fantasy variant/setting.

118982.name: Secret Orders: Eyes of the Purple Cyclops
118982.description:
From Introduction:

The Eyes Of The Purple Cyclops is a sprawling but secretive order of the wealthy, heroic, and otherwise influential. Though mostly male and human, elven, or half elf, the secretive organization holds no barring against anyone that faithfully shares the same interests and goals. Realizing that a sense of order and harmony cannot be truly maintained through the directions of feudal monarchies, powerful dragons, or clerical orders alone, it is the determination of the Purple Cycles and its Eyes to forge a sense of influencing bond to keep the very world from falling into complete and utter anarchy.

118985.name: Space Bastards: Sudden Justice
118985.description:
User Summary:

A block pushing game with over 100 levels. The player controls a "Robosaurus" (bipedal robot with a gun) that can push and shoot blocks of various types (standard crates, TNT boxes, ice blocks, etc.) in an attempt to negotiate the way through and across the various platforms, and reach and destroy all enemies from each level.

Interesting Note: The game name is never displayed in full at any point on the box cover. Although visible 5 times on the front cover, in each instance some (different) portion of the B-word is obscured by a graphical splatter.

118988.name: Monsterhearts

rpghonor.20103: 2012 Golden Geek RPG of the Year Nominee

118988.description:
From the "Buried Without Ceremony" site
Monsterhearts lets you and your friends create stories about sexy monsters, teenage angst, personal horror, and secret love triangles. When you play, you explore the terror and confusion that comes both with growing up and feeling like a monster.

Based on the Apocalypse World engine, this is a game with emergent story, messy relationships, a structured MC role, and a focus on hard choices.

118992.name: Gesundheit!
118992.description:
User Summary

Gesundheit is a puzzle game where the player controls a small pig that escaped his village when monsters attacked. He has to set out and tackle 40 stages to save his friends.

118993.name: X-Com Incursion
118993.description: 2 Player Deck Building Card Game based on the 1993 PC game. Fan Tribute. One player is X-Com, the other is the aliens. There is no common deck. Each player has their own set of cards to build from. Win by destroying your opponent's main base. As Panic Levels rise X-Com loses resources but gains desperate card trashing options. Depending on what cards players research, strategies can shift from Interception heavy, to Tactical heavy, to Research Heavy.

118994.description:
Classic or v2.2 is the second and last Netrunner expansion. It was released over 3 years after Proteus hit the stores. The set was only comprised of 52 cards, sold in 8-card boosters. This "mini-expansion" featured cards that were originally designed for the unreleased expansion "Silent Impact" that never saw the light of day due to WOTC's decision to discontinue the game.

Classic introduced new card types. "Double Preps" and "Double Operations" took two consecutive actions to play but offered larger rewards that would speed up game play and make room for more powerful cards in deck design. In addition to that, a new ice type was added to the Corps arsenal. "Deflectors" now allowed the Corp to send the Runner down the wrong rabbit hole by sending them to another data fort.

Hinting at other innovations to the game that will never be developed, this expansion sadly marks the end of WotC's Netrunner game. The set is highly sought after due to it extreme rarity.
118994.name: Netrunner: Classic

videogame.118996: Assassin's Creed II: Battle of Forli

118995.name: Assassin's Creed II: Complete Edition

videogamecompilation.118996: Assassin's Creed II: Battle of Forli

118995.description:
User Summary

Assassin's Creed II Game of the Year edition includes the two missing game sequences and three Templar Secret Locations. All of these additions are available as DLC for the original Assassin's Creed II game release.


"Assassin's Creed II is a third person action-adventure video game developed by Ubisoft Montreal and published by Ubisoft for the PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 video game consoles, and Microsoft Windows. It is the second video game installment of the Assassin's Creed series and is a direct sequel to the 2007 video game Assassin's Creed. The game was released on video game consoles in November 2009, and released for Windows on 3 March 2010.

The game is set in 2012, with player-controlled protagonist Desmond Miles escaping from Abstergo Industries with an employee, Lucy Stillman, after being forced to relive the genetic memories of ancestral assassin Altaïr ibn La-Ahad through a machine known as the "Animus." After escaping from Abstergo, Desmond enters a device which is more advanced than the Animus and relives the genetic memories of ancestral nobleman Ezio Auditore da Firenze, who lived during the Renaissance period of the late fifteenth century in Italy. The player controls Ezio, who becomes an Assassin after his father and brothers are murdered by a traitor to the Auditore family. While controlling Ezio, the player can explore game renditions of Italian cities, regions and landmarks in open world gameplay. The gameplay is a mixture of action, stealth and platforming."

Source: Wikipedia, "Assassin's_Creed_II," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118996.name: Assassin's Creed II: Battle of Forli
118996.description:
Ezio and Machiavelli make their way to Forli. As they approach something goes wrong: Forli is under attack! Borgia guards are laying siege to the city to retrieve the Templar Treasure Ezio carries.

Source: The Publisher Website.

118997.name: Assassin's Creed II: Bonfire of the Vanities
118997.description:
Ezio is met at the entrance to Florence by Machiavelli – leader of the Florence mercenaries. He explains that the mad monk has taken control of the city. He’s used the apple to control the city’s Nine most influential citizens.

Expand the adventure with the additional content “Bonfire of the Vanities” and 3 exclusive missions: Palazzo Medici, Santa Maria Del Frari and Arsenal Shipyard.

Source: The Publisher Website.

118998.name: JammerUp: The Roller Derby Board Game
118998.description:
JammerUp: The Roller Derby Board Game is a turn-based simulation of modern day roller derby. The rules provide an analogue of the sport's rule set, and many of the same strategies and tactics that work on the track apply to the board game.
In a 2-player game, each player controls a team of 5 game pawns: four Blockers and one Jammer. A player moves her Jammer through the pack, maneuvering around opposing Blockers, to earn points. At the same time, she must position her own blockers to prevent the opposing Jammer from scoring. Pawn movement is simply defined on a hexagonal grid. Blockers can in a counter-clockwise direction; Jammers can move in any direction at all and may "juke" to get around opposing pieces.

There are two ways to play:

Take Your Chances
Players of the Take Your Chances flavorof the game will enjoy drawing cards that allow them to jump, juke, and block in special ways that help them make their way through the pack and defend their territory.

Pure Strategy
Fans of abstract strategy games will skip the cards and dice, relying purely on their ability to outwit their opponent. They'll learn to master real derby strategies like skating the diamond, hammer & nail, and goating.
The game ships with a board, 10 plastic skater pawns, 2 scoring winks, cards, die, and rule book. Optional glass pawns and pewter miniatures are sold separately.

118501.description:
Introduction

February 1942. The Second World War. The final days before the Fall of Singapore.

Already half-way across Singapore, the Imperial Army has smashed through all of our defenses and are now on route to Bukit Chandu. Though massively outnumbered by the Imperial Army, the Malay Regiment, the last of the surviving defenders of Singapore's freedom, has been tasked to fend off as many of the invaders as possible.

Loyal and true; unyielding and unafraid, soldiers of the Malay Regiment will fight tooth and nail in order to defend the nation.


The Gameplay

Each player takes on the role of a different hero and everyone must work together to prevent Imperial Soldiers, Tanks and Warplanes from wiping out every Malay Regiment soldier on Bukit Chandu.

Every turn, Imperial cards are drawn, adding more Imperial units to the board and moving them closer to their goal. Heightening the sense of urgency, with every set of Soldiers, Tanks or Warplanes added to the board, tiles of the board are 'Surged', making the battlefield smaller and smaller.

Players can gain Respect tokens by defeating the various enemies. With more Respect, players can spend more actions to move or to do battle. Unfortunately, it also means more Imperial units are added to the board on their turn.


The Objective

To win, players must gain a number of Respect tokens by defeating various enemies before they are defeated themselves.

It's a game of hard decisions and maddening consequences. Do you have what it takes to protect Bukit Chandu and save Singapore?
118501.name: Regimen: the Lions of Bukit Chandu

118502.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 32 - Sep 1994)
118502.description: This issue contains the 2nd part of new rules idea. It also contains articles about Midgard 1880 and an adventure for it.

118503.name: T-Coincé
118503.description:
The object is to block Your opponents so that they can't play a card.
To succeed, you need to use addition and subtraction to the total of the discard pile is as close (or equal) to 22 without exceeding this value.
Over the rounds the player who can not discard one of his cards will be eliminated. The last player to ask a card is declared the winner.

118504.name: Verbillico version junior
118504.description:
The version for the younger audience of the game Verbillico.
The goal is to gain the maximum time cards and Challenge by combining the verbs correctly. The game ends when all the time and challenge boxes are occupied by the players.
Verbillico combines many qualities. During the course of the game to win, it is obviously necessary to combine correctly, but also be a strategist, negotiator and have a good luck, because the path is strewn with pitfalls.

In his turn player roll the dice and move. There are 3 types of boxes in this game:
1. Time boxes that indicate the time together;
2. Challenge boxes that are testing the players;
3. Trap boxes that reveal the chance of the moment.

If player answers correctly to aquestions and conjugates verbs he places he marks this box with his token.

118505.name: Verbillico version mini
118505.description:
The compact version of the game Verbillico.
The goal is to gain the maximum time cards and Challenge by combining the verbs correctly. The game ends when all the time and challenge boxes are occupied by the players.
Verbillico combines many qualities. During the course of the game to win, it is obviously necessary to combine correctly, but also be a strategist, negotiator and have a good luck, because the path is strewn with pitfalls.

In his turn player roll the dice and move. There are 3 types of boxes in this game:
1. Time boxes that indicate the time together;
2. Challenge boxes that are testing the players;
3. Trap boxes that reveal the chance of the moment.

If player answers correctly to aquestions and conjugates verbs he places he marks this box with his token.

118506.name: Verbillico version excellence
118506.description:
The most harder version of the game Verbillico.
The goal is to gain the maximum time cards and Challenge by combining the verbs correctly. The game ends when all the time and challenge boxes are occupied by the players.
Verbillico combines many qualities. During the course of the game to win, it is obviously necessary to combine correctly, but also be a strategist, negotiator and have a good luck, because the path is strewn with pitfalls.

In his turn player roll the dice and move. There are 3 types of boxes in this game:
1. Time boxes that indicate the time together;
2. Challenge boxes that are testing the players;
3. Trap boxes that reveal the chance of the moment.

If player answers correctly to aquestions and conjugates verbs he places he marks this box with his token.

118507.name: MathSumo
118507.description:
MathSumo mechanism is simple: the cards represents the results and sumos on the board indicate the numbers to multiply. The game is to get rid of his cards by moving a single Sumo at a time and play the card with the result of the 2 sumos.
Special cards allow players to participate in the course of the game.

118508.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 33 - Dec 1994)
118508.description:
The special issue for 10 years Gildenbrief.

It contains an article of gnomes/imps of all kinds at Midgard. Magical artifacts and game in the midgard setting.

118509.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 34 - Mar 1995)
118509.description: This issue contains the adventure "Das Grab des BiChing"

118511.name: Addi Cat's
118511.description:
Addi Cat's is a mathematical card game of memory, concentration and speed.
translated into several languages ​​(English, German, Spanish and Italian): the main rule, the challenges of the additions, the memory and the battle.
You can see the animation to quickly learn to play the main rule.

Players take turns turning their cards over and compare their results. If 2 players have the same result (for instance 7 + 5 and 12), they must hit the mouse card placed in the center of the table (purple card) as fast as possible. The quickest gives his cards to his opponent. SOme bonus cards also included.
The first player to get rid of all his cards wins.

Contents:

100 Addition cards,
19 Sum cards,
19 Action cards
19 "Correction" cards.

118512.name: Multipli Cat's
118512.description:
Multipli Cat's is a card game of calculation, memory, concentration and speed.

Players take turns turning their cards over and compare their results. If 2 players have the same result (for instance 4 x 9 and 36), they must hit the mouse card placed in the center of the table (green card) as fast as possible. The quickest gives his cards to his opponent.
There are six different action cards which give more punch to the game. They either require speed or quick counting.
The first player to get rid of all his cards wins.

118514.name: Samurai in the Sky
118514.description:
The air to air combat game in World War 2 Pacific theater. This game incorporates technology of the Role Playing Games. Usually played with the game master.

Player(s) control a Japanese naval fighter pilot, and performs various missions. Allied aircraft are operated by the game master.
Each mission is played like a typical air combat game. In addition, players let their pilots could survive, let him gain experience, and aim to survive until the end of the war.
The campaign game will start from China in 1940, then transfer to Philippines and Rabaul, until the end of 1943.

118515.description:
There is always a bigger fish!

In the card game Piranhas, players play simultaneously and try to play out all of their cards. On each card are three fishes in different colors and sizes. In the beginning one card lays on the table. Cards can be played on top of this card, when they show a bigger fish in the same color as one of the fishes of the same color on the card on the table. Then there are piranha cards of different colors. They can be played when no fish of the same color is on the table. The feeding frenzy continues until one player has no more cards and wins.
118515.name: Piranhas

118516.name: Oppressive Taxes and Tariffs Volume 1
118516.description:
From Introduction:

Since the dawn of established governments various ruling bodies have sought out one means after another of drawing money from citizens and passing travelers alike. While nations, kingdoms, and communities that we create in our role playing fantasy worlds are purely the basis of our own leisure fiction there is no reason that we cannot have a bit of fun of our own when it comes to oppressing the financial gains of the adventurer and the villager alike. Oppressing Taxes And Tariffs, Volume 1 contains over thirty different ways to bleed that extra bit of coinage out of those who are already struggling to get by in your fantasy realm.

118517.name: Oppressive Taxes and Tariffs Volume 2
118517.description:
From Introduction:

While taxes and tariffs are greeted with disgust in the real world, they can be rather fun when imposed on the other characters of a fantasy campaign setting. After all, why should any self respecting community allow such wealthy adventurers to freely wander about when the village coffers are starving?

This edition of Oppressive Taxes And Tariffs features over a new dozen means of robbing villager, adventurer, and simple traveling alike through the customs of tariffs and tax collection.

118518.description:
Para - Leader introduces paratrooper and glider carried units to Panzer Leader and Panzer Leader 1940 in 10 new scenarios (situations 31 - 40).

The game adds rules conserning the drop of paratroopers and gliders while it introduces the concept of sticks (small units that comrpise, when matched together, a regular paratrooper unit).

Although the "Designer's Notes" in Panzer Leader state the difficulties regarding the tactical simulation of paratroop action (mainly because of the lack of proper intel) the designer of Para - Leader refers to this arguement as "not completely valid" due to the fact that all units on the board are open to both players thus, self negating this military inteligence chaos.

Components:
- 141 Allied, German and aircraft counters
- 10 scenarios
- Rules and designer notes

Published in The GENERAL Vol.20,No.2 (July/August 1983).
118518.name: Para-Leader

rpg.3183: RoboMACs: the Giant Robot Roleplaying Game

118519.name: RoboMACs: the Giant Robot Roleplaying Game
118519.description:
From the Introduction:

MAC - Mobile Artificial Consciousness. Any self-motivating machine intelligence designed to operate some kind of body that allows it mobility. Of course, MACs are *able* to move, but like mobile homes, don't always do so.

Robo - Shorthand for RObot BOdy. Humans and MACs alike can pilot Robos, but MACs do a much better job and tend to dominate the scene... hence the name of the game.

This game is for all the fans of giant robot cartoons and live action shows who want to roleplay those kind of characters, but have found other systems too wargame-like. RoboMACs tries to have more of a dramatic, cinematic flavor to it, and tends to replace hard numbers with general traits and 'hooks.' The bias will be towards RoboMACs as opposed to humans piloting Robos, and towards transforming Robos over static ones, due to the author's love of Hasbro's Transformers (TM) toys and cartoon.

118520.name: Numé Cat's
118520.description:
Each player has a stack of green cards face down in front of him. The 18 yellow cards with the numbers are placed in the center of the table.

In his turn player turns a card face-up and reads an enigma.
The other players must hit as fast as possible on the number they think is the right answer. The fastest receives the "enigma" card.

When all the "enigma" cards have been given, each player counts the number of cards he has won. The winner is the one with the most cards.

There are 340 simple mathematical problems, divided into 3 categories : "French language and numbers", "Mathematical language" and "Operations".

118521.name: Numé Cat's Kid
118521.description:
Numé Cat's for younger players

Each player has a stack of green cards face down in front of him. The 18 yellow cards with the numbers are placed in the center of the table.

In his turn player turns a card face-up and reads an enigma.
The other players must hit as fast as possible on the number they think is the right answer. The fastest receives the "enigma" card.

When all the "enigma" cards have been given, each player counts the number of cards he has won. The winner is the one with the most cards.

There are 180 simple mathematical problems, divided into 3 categories : "French language and numbers", "Mathematical language" and "Operations".

118522.name: Numé Cat's junior
118522.description:
In every turn players turn cards over and compare the number they get with the other players' numbers.

If 2 players have the same number (for instance six squares, "six" or "6"), they must hit as fast as possible on the "cheese" card placed in the center of the table.

The quickest player gives his cards to his opponent and plays again by turning a new card over.

The first player who gets rid of all his cards wins.

118523.name: Conju Cat's
118523.description:
Each their turn, players turn a card over and compare the tense of their verb with the tenses of the other players. If 2 players have the same tense (for instance "présent" and "finissons"), they must hit the "cheese" card placed in the center of the table as fast as possible.
The fastest player gives his cards to his opponent. Six different special cards give more intrust to the game.

The first player to have no more cards left wins.

118524.name: Grammi Cat's
118524.description:
Each player has a stack of cards face down in front of him.
The 9 cards with the grammatical categories are placed in the center of the table.

The players take turns turning their cards over, read a sentence then one of the bold words. The other players must hit the right grammatical category as fast as possible. The quickest receives the "sentences" card.

When all the "sentences" cards have been given out, each player count the number of cards he has won.
The winner is the one with the most "sentences" cards.

118525.name: Ortho Cat's 3: Les mots
118525.description:
The game covers 10 sounds and their writings: en/an/em/am, on/om, in/un/ain/un, o/au/eau, è/ê/ai/e/ei, j/g, s/z, f/ff/ph, s/c/ç/ss/t, c/k/qu.

Each player has a stack of cards face down in front of him.
The 18 ending cards are placed at the center of the table.

Each his turn, players turn a card over, give the sound of the ending and then read the sentence. The other players must hit on the right ending as fast as possible. The fastest player receives the "sentence" card. And you start over,the next player turns his card over...

When all the "sentence" cards have been given out, each player counts the number of cards he has won.
The winner is the one with the most cards.

118526.name: Ortho Cat's 2: Les homophones grammaticaux
118526.description:
The game is on 18 grammatical homophones :
ou/où, on/ont, a/à, est/et, ce/se, c'est/s'est/ses/ces, son/sont, leur/leurs.

Each player has a stack of cards face down in front of him.
The 18 ending cards are placed at the center of the table.

Each his turn, players turn a card over, give the sound of the ending and then read the sentence. The other players must hit on the right ending as fast as possible. The fastest player receives the "sentence" card. And you start over,the next player turns his card over...

When all the "sentence" cards have been given out, each player counts the number of cards he has won.
The winner is the one with the most cards.

118527.name: Ortho Cat's
118527.description:
Ortho Cat's is a fun way to considerably improve your level in french spelling concernant of words with endings in "i", "é" and "u" : past participles, conjugated verbs, adjectives.

Each player has a stack of cards face down in front of him.
The 18 ending cards are placed at the center of the table.

Each his turn, players turn a card over, give the sound of the ending and then read the sentence. The other players must hit on the right ending as fast as possible. The fastest player receives the "sentence" card. And you start over,the next player turns his card over...

When all the "sentence" cards have been given out, each player counts the number of cards he has won.
The winner is the one with the most cards.

118528.name: Alpha Cat's
118528.description:
The players take turns turning their cards over and compare their letter with the other players' letters. If two players have the same letter (capital or small), they must hit the "Cheese" card in the center of the table as fast as possible.
The fastest player gives his cards to his opponent. Six different Action cards give more punch to the game.

The first player to get rid of all his cards wins.

118529.name: My Word Coach
118529.description:
My Word Coach offers a fun and challenging way to improve verbal skills through a series of engaging activities and exercises.

The game was inspired by ongoing vocabulary acquisition research by Thomas Cobb, University Professor in Applied Linguistics at the University of Quebec (www.lextutor.ca/cv/).

Enjoyable activities include word recognition, spelling challenges, and vocabulary definition, including 16,800 words from the Cambridge Advanced Learner's Dictionary.

When you play, My Word Coach assesses, monitors, and rewards your Expression Potential, a score that represents your ability to command and use the English language. The higher the number (out of a possible 100%), the better you are able to express yourself!

Source: The Publisher Website.

118531.name: Portal
118531.description:
The main rule book for Portal. Contains beastiary and an introduction scenario.

Translated rule book back

An action role playing game that takes you beyond your worst nightmares!
During centuries, dark mages have opened portals to other worlds and dimension. Countless beings have sneaked through these and are infecting our world. To stop this onslaught, the Organization, a community without name nor symbol, was formed. As player, you are one of the agents of the Organization and you are to fight the powers of darkness.

Portal is a simple and quick-played role playing game taking place in today's time. As an agent, your skills and disciplines are tested to their utmost. The simple system makes Portal an excellent beginner RPG.

118532.name: Level 3
118532.description: A 3D tic-tac-toe variant with a random element, where the randomizer is provided by an electronic LED doohickey in the base of the board (requires 9-volt battery). The randomizer determines a random space (on the 3d tic-tac-toe board), and if it's occupied, its owner must remove the piece.

118533.name: Serial Bluffer
118533.description:
The set of 50 cards consists of combinations of 5 colors and 5 figures. The order of the numbers, everyone knows, but there is also an order of colors, shown in part on a special card, and recalled the other on the back of each card.

The goal is to get rid of his cards by asking a sequence dictated by a die type: numbers, or color, and 1 to 3 cards. The cards are face down except the last. We can blame the previous player for asking illegal cards, of course at his own risk.

118534.name: Anagram
118534.description:
The object of the game is to make words with the highest value.

Each player takes 12 letters at random. They try to form words with the anagrams. In the case where the player can call such a word, he can put it anywhere on the board in order to score maximum points, trying to put the letter of a given color on a square with the same color
The game ends when one player has made five anagrams. The winner is then the one who scored the most points.

118535.name: À vos marques
118535.description:
It is the game of speed and consumer knowledge.

You must as soon as possible, collect the cards corresponding to a specific criterion, or a named brand. You get the cards using a special vacuum.

Examples of criteria: "Mark in four letters," "Cheese," "product that makes the bubbles." etc.

A good knowledge of the consumer society is essential.

118536.description:
Police Precinct is a cooperative/semi-cooperative game where players are tasked with solving a mysterious murder while simultaneously working to keep crime on the streets under control, and to keep the city from falling into chaos.

Players take on the role of police officers with different areas of expertise. The players work together to solve the mystery by collecting evidence and eventually arresting the suspect.

Complicating matters is the fact that there may or may not be a corrupt officer that is being paid off by the murderer to suppress evidence, the same evidence everyone else is trying to uncover.

Players move around the city searching through randomly shuffled investigation cards for evidence in relation to the murder. The number of investigation cards drawn depends on the character’s rating as well as how many player cards are added by other players to boost the character’s rating for the current “search”. There are four decks of investigation cards (Interview Witness, Collect Crime Scene Evidence, Examine Body and Locate Murder Weapon) to be searched. These decks are shuffled and placed in different locations. So, a player might search the cards in one area and not find any evidence at all… or maybe the bribed cop, if there is one, did the searching and just said no evidence was found.

Players have to find all of the evidence cards from the investigation decks to be able to arrest the murderer.

At the end of each player’s turn they draw an event card. These cards represent growing crime and emergencies that are happening in the city. Each one piles on top of the other, and if the cops don't stay on top of things, they will be buried in crime! These Event cards are placed on the game board at the locations where they occur. Some of them have “unknown circumstance” tokens placed face-down upon them, adding even more tension.

If too many criminals are located in one area, a gang is formed. Each gang has its own power and can cripple the police efforts if not handled quickly and carefully.

So, not only are the players investigating the murder, but they must also arrest street criminals and handle emergencies.

Sometimes when a character successfully completes a task, that character is rewarded with a doughnut token. These tokens can later be used to help with tasks. However, if the character does not complete the task in time, the city crime track advances. The track can also advance if street crimes grow so large that no more street criminals can be placed, when called for. If the Crime Track advances to the end, the murderer escapes justice and the good cops fail the game.

To add to the tension even further, The good cops only have so many days to complete the investigation. If time runs out, once again the murderer shall escape justice!

The pressure is great and the stakes are high!
118536.name: Police Precinct

118537.name: Fortress Sevastopol
118537.description:
October 1941: After the initial success against the Russian “Bear” in the summer of 1941 the German advance slowed down. Hitler advised the commander of the 17th Army, General Erich von Manstein, to take the Crimean Peninsula and the important port of Sevastopol before the winter weather would set in.

After a quick successful campaign with the final conquest of the Crimea as its goal, the German Wehrmacht should have gained itself a good stepping stone for the next summer offensive to reach the most important oilfields of the Caucasus. Also the mighty Black Sea Fleet would be disloged to the far away port of Batumi...

But history took a different turn. The initial assault failed to take the fortress. The Russians counterattacked in the winter with some success. And so Manstein’s final conquest of the mighty Crimean fortress lasted until July 1942 when there were no more Soviet fighting formations on the Crimea.

Fortress Sevastopol is a simulation of the German assault on the Crimean Peninsula. The Germans had to advance to Sevastopol as quickly as possible. Eventually the mighty fortress will have to surrender before the snow falls, which would be a great pleasure for the "Führer". If not, you will have to wait until spring to receive more reserves and finally capture Sevastopol before the game ends.

If you play the Russian side: stay cool! Try to avoid losses in the initial onslaught. Collect units and reserves in the winter months for an eventual counterstrike at the German weak points. If this is unsuccessful, go for entrenchments and fight for every meter in Sevastopol til the end.

Fortress Sevastopol uses an easy to learn area movement and combat system. A similar system was already used in games like Breakout Normandy, Monty's Gamble - Market Garden, and Storm Over Arhhem. Fortress Sevastopol is Issue #8 in UBB's Command & Strategy magazine series.

118538.name: Let's Play Garden
118538.description:
User Summary

Let's Play Garden is a simulation mini-game compilation where you can grow your garden through multiple seasons. Play through minigames and learn about plants and growing a garden.

118539.name: Medieval Conspiracy
118539.description:
Medieval Conspiracy introduces players to the Holy Roman Empire of Germany. That Empire is divided into numberless small earldoms, principalities, and bishoprics. The Ruler of the Empire is the Holy Roman Emperor who is elected by the 7 electoral princes.

In Medieval Conspiracy you take the role of a mighty noble family. Increase your power, gain new countries, get votes of the electoral princes to finally be elected the new Holy Roman Emperor.

Game Play

Medieval conspiracy is run by Action cards and Event cards. After collecting income players bid for Event cards. 3 Event cards are displayed on their open side. Thereafter players bid for them in turn order. The player who got an Event card can use it later during his turn.

During a player turn players roll the dice of destiny and play event and action cards. That card play results in numerous effects giving each game a new special course.

Players gain new countries or conquer them by force from others.

Are you up to be the new Holy Roman Emperor?

118540.name: Let's Play Fashion Designer
118540.description:
Welcome to Lets Play Fashion Designer, feel free to browse around and try a few things on.

In Lets Play Fashion Designer, the player plays a young fashion mad student. Her dream is to become one of the best know fashion designers in the business, and one day manage her own prestigious boutique.

Spurred on by her friends' enthusiasm, she decides to open up a local boutique. Little does she know that one day her boutiques will become bigger and better, until she has her own prestigious stores and collaborations with some of the greatest names in fashion.

Custom design necklaces, rings, bracelets, earrings, hats, and more to your customer's specification

Take care not to make mistakes. An open link in a bracelet will cause it to break and you will have to start over, if its not made to the customers requirements or if your late in delivering the items they wont be Welcome to Lets Play Fashion Designer, feel free to browse around and try a few things on.

In Lets Play Fashion Designer, the player plays a young fashion mad student. Her dream is to become one of the best know fashion designers in the business, and one day manage her own prestigious boutique.

Spurred on by her friends' enthusiasm, she decides to open up a local boutique. Little does she know that one day her boutiques will become bigger and better, until she has her own prestigious stores and collaborations with some of the greatest names in fashion.

Custom design necklaces, rings, bracelets, earrings, hats, and more to your customer's specification. Take care not to make mistakes. An open link in a bracelet will cause it to break and you will have to start over, if its not made to the customers requirements or if your late in delivering the items they wont be happy!

Source: The Publisher Website.

118541.name: Caméléon
118541.description:
In this game you must try to align three balls with different colors (blue, red and yellow) on their respective color (blue ball on blue square etc.) on the board horizontally or vertically.
This alignment can be achieved with one or more white balls (chameleons) who take the color of the square where they are.

In his turn, player pushes a ball from the lines outside of the board to the 3x3 grid board and sometimes this may push one ball out of the board to the outside lines.

118542.name: Line Rider 2: Unbound
118542.description:
Line Rider, originally released in the fall of 2006, is an elaborate, yet accessible physics toy that features a character who sleds on any user drawn slope. Upon release, the game became an Internet phenomenon, attracting a cult following and ballooning into an obsession for many intrepid course designers. Line Rider 2: Unbound features the work of one of the most famous designers, TechDawg, who's creations can be seen at IRideTheLines.com.

Source: The Game Website.

118543.name: Littlest Pet Shop: Friends
118543.description:
LITTLEST PET SHOP Friends for the Wii features co-op play so girls can share the fun alongside their real-life best friends. Framed by a rich storyline and high-quality in-game cinematics, girls embark on a journey filled with activities such as delivering party invitations and serving up cake and ice cream, to completing more than a dozen special tasks on their way to arriving at the big celebration.

Source: The Developer Website.

118544.name: London Taxi: Rush Hour
118544.description:
TAXI!! It’s London, it’s Rush-hour and you’re a cabbie on a mission!

• Drive down busy streets causing havoc, tear through the underground and cut across parks in a race to deliver passengers on time!

• A FULL map of central London packed with famous landmarks.

• Use whatever route you can possibly find to get to your destination in the quickest time.

• Choose from 4 different cabbies each with their own unique official Austin FX4 London Taxi.

• Use the Wii Remote in the driving position to control the taxi around the busy London traffic.

Do you have the knowledge? Are you up to the job, the meters running…

Source: The Publisher Website.

118545.name: Lost in Blue: Shipwrecked
118545.description:
A teenage boy, Aidan, and his pet monkey, Hobo, are on a cruise ship. The boat starts to sink. Aidan gets onto a lifeboat with Hobo. The lifeboat dashes away, but soon comes to a stop. The pilot announces that the propeller is stuck. Aidan volunteers to go and free it. The boat shakes and Aidan is thrown into the current with Hobo. He starts to drift away. A man on the lifeboat tosses him a suitcase. Aidan grabs the suitcase. Hobo hops on top of the suitcase. Soon, Aidan wakes up on an island. He explores it until he sees a larger island in the distance. He builds a raft out of the suitcase and some driftwood. He and Hobo sail over to the larger island. The raft breaks apart as he reaches the island, and all his belongings float away. He is greeted by a teenage girl, Lucy, when he gets there. They band together and start to explore the island.

Source: Wikipedia, "Lost in Blue: Shipwrecked", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118546.name: M&M's Adventure
118546.description:
User Summary

Take control of Red, Yellow, and Green in their big adventure. They are on a mission to track down the missing candy, and in order to find it they'll need to explore every sector of the factory.

Features

- Each character has unique special abilities to help them get through the stages.
- A dangerous boss awaits at the end of each of the 6 levels.

118547.name: Holding Pattern
118547.description:
Holding Pattern is an adult air travel game designed for 2-4 players.

Players move their tokens from the start position to the finish position. players must use the assigned course on the game board paying appropriate tariffs and fees. The player who reaches the finish position with the most money wins.

118548.name: M&M's Beach Party
118548.description:
Your favorite M&M’S candy characters are serving up summertime fun in M&M’S Beach Party! Get on your feet and compete in six unique and physically challenging games like the Kayak Race, the Mr. Runch Slam, and Skee-Ball! What day at the beach would be complete without Beach Volleyball? Bump, set, and spike your way to victory during a full-length volleyball game!

6 Games including Ring Toss, Mr. Runch Slam, Volleyball, Canoe Race, Shooting Gallery and Skee-ball.

Source: The Developer Website.

118549.name: M&M's Kart Racing
118549.description:
Back of the box

Fasten your seat belts for the exciting new action racing game, M&M's Kart Racing! M&M's Kart Racing breathes new life into the arcade racing by combining adventure elements and high speed racing with the funny and parodic style of candy competition. Compete against other players on 10 different race tracks and collect unique bonus items on each level.

118550.name: Mad Dog McCree: Gunslinger Pack
118550.description:
The live action, six-shooting, Wild West adventures of Mad Dog McCree are blazing their way to your Wii. Take on the role of the Bounty Hunter in this collection of all three classic arcade shooters: Mad Dog McCree, Mad Dog 2: The Lost Gold, and The Last Bounty Hunter. Bring your own brand of justice to the ruthless evil plaguing the Wild West, once and for all.

Features

- The first live action shooter on the Wii
- Great value: Play any of three classic games on one Wii disc for only $19.99
- Use your Wii Remote as your virtual six-shooter to take down outlaws coming at you from all angles. Test your mettle in any of three difficulty modes: Deputy, Sheriff, or U.S Marshall
- Track down the infamous Mad Dog McCree, or the four most wanted fugitives: Handsome Harry, Nasty Dan, El Loco, and Cactus Kid
- Play any of two multiplayer modes: Posse Mode lets you work together as a posse of up to 4 bounty hunters on the trail of Mad Dog McCree, the four outlaws, and all of their henchmen for a combined high score. Rebel Mode lets you work independently with up to 4 bounty hunters on the trail of Mad Dog McCree, the four outlaws, and all of their henchmen for individual high scores and only one winner
- Test your reflexes in nail-biting Showdowns. An old fashioned draw pits you against one villain; whose gun is faster?
- Wii Zapper support

Source: The Publisher Website.

118551.description:
The Down In Flames-Wingmen Expansion includes Wingmen cards for all the fighters appearing in DiF: Aces High and DiF: Guns Blazing.

Wingmen aid your Leader in attacking, and help to protect him when under attack. The Wingmen rules are simple and easy to incorporate, fitting on to one sheet of paper. These include the rules for incorporating Wingmen into Campaign games.

Component List:
160 Aircraft Cards
1 Page of Rules
118551.name: Down in Flames: Wingmen Expansion

118552.name: Choplifter HD
118552.description:
In Choplifter HD, players take on the role of an up and coming rescue pilot asked to join the elite, international helicopter rescue team. Pilots will be trained to command a variety of helicopters deployed on more than 30 different missions. Combining reality with elements of fantasy, missions will range from captured military prisoner extraction to saving survivors of viral outbreaks. Pilots must bank, hover, touch-down and sometimes even shake zombies from their chopper during lift-off in order to make their rescue and complete their mission. Developed and published by inXile Entertainment, Choplifter HD dares players to risk their lives in order to save others.

Source: The Game Website.

118553.name: Ubongo Trigo
118553.description:
The Ubongo series has already challenged players with deciphering where to play shapes composed of squares (Ubongo itself), blocks (Ubongo 3D) and hexagons (Ubongo Extreme), so with Ubongo Trigo, the triangles now come into play.

Each player has seven shapes, each composed of a unique combination of triangles and each colored differently. In each round of the game, each player takes a puzzle board that uses four shapes (or six on the tough side) to create two images. Players are presented only with the images' silhouettes, so they need to determine how to combine which shapes – with which sides face up and in which direction - to create the two images on their card.

The first player to do so starts counting down from 20 (30 for the tough side), and any other player who doesn't complete her board before that first player reaches zero gives her card to that other player as a point; any player who does complete the puzzles in time (including the first player) keeps his own board for a point. The player with the most points after eight rounds wins!

118554.name: Was ist Was: Junior – Pferde & Ponys
118554.description:
What do horses like to eat? What things do you need for horse care? What can be discovered in the paddock?

In Was ist Was - Junior: Pferde & Ponys, forty cards show everything that girls want to know about horses in ten different topics. These forty cards are first revealed at the start of the game, then hidden. A player draws a topic card – say, horse care – which will show 3-5 items that are on individual cards. Players try to remember where these items are and reveal them; with each success, a player moves her horse pawn one space forward on the track. Whoever reaches the goal line first wins!

118555.name: Crickard
118555.description:
A cricket card game, probably from the fifties because Trever Bailey is pictured on the box. He was a England Test Match player in that era.

Take two of the four 'Out' cards out of the deck and shuffle the rest. The cards dealt into four piles, all face down. Take one of these piles out of play and use the other three shuffled together. To decide the outcome of each delivery, turn over the top card and follow its instructions. Most of the time it will be a number of runs scored but it could say 'Out' or other options. If four wickets have fallen, add another 'Out' card into the remaining cards and shuffle them again. If 6 wickets fall, add the other 'Out' card. These rules both indicate that later batsmen are easier to get out by the bowler.

Two innings are played and the one with the best score, wins.

118556.name: Legend Dominoes
118556.description:
Very rare game from around the turn of the 20th century.

The cards feature characters and scenes from famous fairy stories. When laid out in a set of four, the bottom of each card can be read, in squence, and providing a précis of the story.

Deal out a number of cards and stack the rest in a draw pile (called the Pool back then). On your turn you must add a card to one of the stories (and it must be the correct card in the sequence, not just a card related to that story). If you cannot go, you draw a card from the Pool. The first player to use their last card, wins.

If reversed, the cards can be used as a regular set of dominoes.

118557.name: Licence to Kill
118557.description:
A rare promotional card game made by Golden Wonder, a manufacturer of crisps in Britain.

The game, which can be played by 2-6 players, consists of:

a) 12 assignment files, each file giving the names and visual characteristics of the four enemy Agents to be captured and

(b) pictures of all 48 enemy Agents which together with 4."Licence to Kill" cards make up the pack of 52 playing cards.

Objects of the Game: Each player is given an assignment file which outlines the 4 Agents he must capture (the details on this file are not divulged to the other players until the end of the game). Using the pack of 52 cards, the players try to capture each of the Agents listed in their assignment file.

Deal 4 cards to each player and place the remaining cards face downwards on the table. (We will call this Pack A). The player on the left of the dealer then picks up a card from Pack A. If this is a card he wants he discards one of the cards in his hand. If it is of no use, the card is thrown down. Unwanted cards are placed face upwards in Pack B. In turn, each player can take the top card from either Pack A or B. One card must always be put back on to Pack B as at no time must you have more than 4 cards in your hand.

In each game you will find 4 "Licence to Kill" cards. If you are lucky enough to obtain one of these cards, you may interrupt the game at any time and exchange it for a card thrown on to Pack B.

Once all the cards in Pack A have been used, the cards in Pack B are turned face down and the game continues as before.

118558.name: Knight's Cross
118558.description:
The air to air combat game in World War 2 European theater. This game incorporates technology of the Role Playing Games. Usually played with the game master.
The basic system is the same as Samurai in the Sky.

Player(s) control a Luftwaffe (German Air force) fighter pilot, and performs various missions. Allied aircraft are operated by the game master. Each mission is played like a typical air combat game. In addition, players let their pilots could survive, let him gain experience, and aim to survive until the end of the war. The campaign game will start from Spain in 1936 (or can be select later time), then transfer to Poland, Western and Eastern front, until the end of war in 1945.

118559.description:
Syracuse (415/413 BC) covers the land and naval battles as well as the siege of Syracuse during the Peloponnesian War.

It is a two players game: Athens and allies vs. Syracuse and allies.
One game turn covers three months.

The game includes:
- 1 16 pages rules booklet (14,4x21 cm)
- 1 29,7x41 cm Map (27 land zones and 12 sea zones)
- 1 counter sheet of 108 die-cut counters (68 leaders and combat units, 22 stratagems counters and 18 markers
- 1 historical scenario and a “What if? Scenario” including Alcibiades as main Athenian leader

Players will be able to build forts and walls, to launch naval operations and to lead land battles.

Note: The rules are based on Sphacteria ones, which appeared in Vae Victis magazine issue #95. These rules include specifics on siege activities and construction of fortifications and several additional developments.
118559.name: Syracuse (415/413 av. J.-C.)

118560.name: 23,000ft
118560.description:
A Ludo style roll the dice and move game, with 3 different variations.

Take Off
Each player has four planes, 1 at the airfield and 3 in the terminal. Roll the dice and move your plane from the airfield or along the flight path, if you land on another plane they go back to the nearest empty space. Rolling a six allows you to bring a plane from your terminal to the airfield and gives you another go. When one of your planes reaches 32,000ft (this does not have to be an exact throw) you remove it to your '32' spaces next to your terminal. The first to get all four planes to 32,000ft is the winner.

Land
Play works as above, but you start at 32,000ft and work your way down to the airfield, landing has to be an exact throw or you overshoot the runway.

Take Off & Land
Choose which players are going to 'Take Off' and which players are going to 'Land' and place planes accordingly. Enter the flight path either way by the amount you throw with the dice. If you settle into airspace that is occupied by another player then your opponents plane must leave the flight path altogether and return to its starting position.
Roll a six to get another plane on the flight path, after rolling a six place the plane six airspaces in. You do not need to throw the exact number when finishing. Then put your plane either at 23,000ft or in your terminal and airfield depending on whether you were Taking Off or Landing. The first person to successfully complete their flight with all their aircraft is the winner.

118561.name: Sequence
118561.description:
Sequence is played with numbers or letters. The game is based on an idea which eliminates both arithmetic and word-formation. The object is to place numbers (ranging from 1 to 10) or letters (ranging from A to Z) in sequences on a limited number of squares.

The pieces are drawn at random from bags. Both numbers and letters are graded. The numbers are themselves equivalent to points. The letters range in value from 1 (for A) to 26 (for Z).

The winner is either the first player to dispose of all his pieces or the one left with the lowest number of unused points.

118562.name: Aventurischer Bote (Issue 77 - Mar/Apr 1999)
118562.description:
The first issue after the end of the campaign about Borbarad.

Rohaja of Gareth is crowned queen of Garethia and Almada. The troops of Weiden attack the city of Yol-Ghurmak, the former Ysilia.
Included is an issue of the Salamander.

118563.name: Aventurischer Bote (Issue 78 - May/Apr 1999)
118563.description:
The kingdoms of Andergast, Aranien and Albernia get new kings or queens.
Included is a 2 page issue of the Salamander

118564.name: Aventurischer Bote (Issue 79 - Jul/Aug 1999)
118564.description: A bloody marriage in Rommilys and other news from around Aventuria.

118565.name: The Blue & The Grey
118565.description:
The Blue & The Grey is a Civil War card game which pits two players against one another in a battle between the United States of America and the Confederate States of America.

Two players choose and play as one of four famous Generals who possess their own special bonuses.

Both sides have in their arsenal Conscripts, Career Infantrymen, Cavalry, Cannons, and Gatling Guns. Additionally, each deck has Research & Development cards which allow for certain advantages over the other player. Some of these include: Balloon Reconnaissance, rifling, and the hiring of mercenary Native Americans!

Will your battle change history for the Confederacy or follow history and reunite the Union?

118567.description:
During the Roman Empire, gladiator combat was the most popular form of entertainment. Fighters from all parts of the Empire were included in the shows, including female gladiators, wealthy Roman citizens and in some cases, even aristocrats. Now the time has come for you to gain the immortal glory of the Arena. Fight for your honor, for fame, and for your life!

Gladiatori is a card-driven game in which each player assumes the role of a gladiator in the Ancient Roman Empire. Action selection drives figure movement on the board. Combat cards give energy to the character actions and are used as hit points. Characters are customizable, and each player has to choose his deck composition, character skills, and participate in the auctions for Arena items. At the end, the winner will be determined by victory points – or simply by being the only one left alive!

This is not the usual fast, face-to-face combat game in which you attack opponents with a roll of dice. It contains many strategic and tactical aspects, and no luck factors (other than in the solo game). Customization of characters makes the combat always different: Your gladiator may be strong against some opponents and weak against others. Let's start finding your way to win!

Gladiatori Deluxe is a limited edition version of the game that includes eight metal miniatures — four gladiators and four animals (dog, wolf, bear, lion) — and a revised 2.0 English-language rulebook with the other languages being available online.
118567.name: Gladiatori

boardgamehonor.21016: 2012 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Kinder Recommended

118568.description:
Ubongo Junior takes the familiar tile-laying, pattern-matching play from Ubongo and scales it down for a younger audience.

In Ubongo Junior, each player starts the game with nine tiles – each of a different color and shape, and each showing an animal – along with a stack of seven puzzle boards. The puzzle boards show an arrangement of squares that can be covered with two tiles (on the easy side) or three (on the hard side); the tiles to be used are depicted on the board.

At the start of each round, each player reveals her board, finds the tiles needed, then races to place them appropriately. The first player to do so flips a sandtimer, then grabs gems from a bag, 2-4 depending on the number of players in the game. The next player to complete her puzzle in time grabs one fewer gem, and so on.

The player who has accumulated the most gems after seven rounds wins!
118568.name: Ubongo Junior

118569.description:
Special cake is a two players game playable with the Shibumi game system. It uses the 4×4 holes board and 30 balls of the set. The game consists of three variants, created together, at the same time: "mint and liquorice candies", "sugar candies" and "mint, liquorice and cherry candies (aka the poisoned candy)".

Mint and liquorice candies
In the “mint and liquorice candies” variant the balls are 15 white (mint candies) and 15 black (liquorice candies).
Rules
Set up: a player places a mint candy and the other a liquorice candy until the pyramid (the cake) is complete. The candies can be placed either on empty board holes or stacking on 2x2 platforms of existing candies.
Game: the game starts when the cake is complete. Players take turns eating (removing) a candy, either mint or liquorice, or a line of mint and liquorice candies. The candies forming the line can be removed, one-by-one, in any desired order.
A line is a straight group (in 3D) of at least two tastes touching candies, either orthogonally if they are in the same level or one on top of the other if they are in different levels. The lines don't wrap around corners or edges (since in this case they are not really straight when you consider the 3D space).
The player who eats the last candy loses the game.

Sugar candies
The “sugar candies” variant of the game uses 30 balls, randomly selected among the whole Shibumi set of 16 white balls, 16 black balls and 16 red balls.
Rules
The game starts with all the 30 candies placed to form the complete square pyramid (the cake). Players take turns eating (removing) a candy or a line of touching candies. The candies forming the line can be removed, one-by-one, in any desired order.
A line is a straight group (in 3D) of at least two touching candies, either orthogonally if they are in the same level or one on top of the other if they are in different levels. The lines don't wrap around corners or edges (since in this case they are not really straight when you consider the 3D space).
The player who eats the last candy loses the game.

Mint, liquorice and cherry candies (aka the poisoned candy)
In the mint, liquorice and cherry candies variant of the game the balls are 15 white (mint candies), 14 black (liquorice candies) and one red ball (cherry candy).
Rules
Set up: a player places a mint candy and the other a liquorice candy till the 29th candy, then the cherry candy is placed on the top of the pyramid (the cake). The candies can be placed either on empty board holes or stacking on 2x2 platforms of existing candies.
Game: the game starts when the cake is complete. Players take turns eating (removing) a candy, either mint or liquorice, or a line of mint and liquorice candies. The candies forming the line can be removed, one-by-one, in any desired order.
A line is a straight group (in 3D) of at least two tastes touching candies, either orthogonally if they are in the same level or one on top of the other if they are in different levels. The lines don't wrap around corners or edges (since in this case they are not really straight when you consider the 3D space).
The player who eats the cherry candy loses the game (and, if it is poisoned, the life, too!).

Notes
According to the Shibumi drop mechanism, when a ball is removed, then any others that it supports will drop. Any ball that directly supports two or more on the level above is pinned and cannot be removed.
Due to the drop mechanism and to the possibility to remove a straight group of balls, one-by-one, a ball of the line that you want to remove, pinned at the beginning of the move, can become unpinned during the move after the removal of another ball of the group, thus allowing its removing. The players are not forced to remove full lines, i.e. the longest lines in that direction.

Online play

Special cake can be played online (real time) at igGameCenter - http://www.iggamecenter.com/info/en/sandboxshibumi.html
118569.name: Special cake

118570.name: Tractatum Unum: De arte faschiamo artefacti magici...
118570.description:
user summary

... (the complete name is 10 lines long)

This is a sourcebook for SAGA and includes the creating and using of magical Items and artifacts. This book contains the complete rules to bring a spell permantly into an artifact.

The print run was limited to 500 copies all signed by the archmagus Pro Klem

118572.name: We're gonna hang out the Washing on the Siegfried Line
118572.description:
Patriotic game that drew its inspiration from the popular song during the Second World War.

Rules inside the lid as follows;

1. The game may be played by any number.
2. The object of the game is to get all the washing hung on the line (i.e., set out on the table in front of each player).
3. Shuffle the small Washing Cards, and deal to each an equal number. Put any cards left over back in the box.
4. Shuffle the large cards and place them face down in the centre of the table in one pile.
5. Each player chooses any three Washing Cards from his own hand, and passes them on to the player on his left.
6. Everyone takes it in turn to pick a card from the central pile, and places it face up alongside. He may hang an article on the line as soon as he picks a card with the correct washing cost. A player picking a hazard card takes back into his hand any of his washing on the table that is specified, or otherwise obeys the instructions on the card. All hazard cards count as a turn. Each time the central pack has been gone through, re-shuffle and carry on.
7. When one player succeeds in hanging up all his washing, the other players add up the money-value of the washing not hung out, and this is counted against them. Then proceed with the next round.
Any number of rounds may be played, the winner being with the least money-value at the end of play. Alternatively a price-limit of, say, five shillings or seven shillings and six pence may be fixed. Any player reaching this limit drops out, and play continues until only the winner is left.

118573.name: Jennifer Government: NationStates
118573.description:
NationStates is a nation simulation game. Create a nation according to your political ideals and care for its people. Or deliberately oppress them. It's up to you.

Source: The Publisher Website.

Jennifer Government: NationStates is a multiplayer nation simulation browser game. It was created by Max Barry and was based loosely on his novel Jennifer Government. The game is expanded by users using off-site forums to construct centres of learning, discussion and play.

The object of the game is to lead a country in the way the player finds best. At the start of the game, the player chooses a few basic characteristics including country name, flag, motto, currency, national animal and style of government. Answers to the questions in the next page determine the initial ratings of the country's civil, economic and political rights. The nation's population starts at five million and increases every day automatically with play.
Issues

Gameplay hinges on deciding government policies: the player is presented with automatically assigned "issues" and chooses a response from a list of options. Players can ignore issues by dismissing them, which has no effect on the nation. All issues have a peculiar characteristic, and no option is the "correct" one. Each usually has a positive and a negative aspect, although the latter is usually highlighted, and both are always exaggerated. Many issues are posed in terms of radical or extremist beliefs, and the accompanying opinions are rarely well-founded. This is for both humorous and didactic reasons: many opinions are extremely funny or ridiculous, and the player learns that there are no perfect ideas which will work in every case. As gameplay progresses, the user learns that each of the options provided for the proposed issues become more ridiculous and offer no stability to the nationstate. Although this is a simulation game of creating your own nation, the responses are often unrealistic and do not provide many middle-ground options to resolve the issues. Instead, the issues are used to drastically change your nation's economic, political, or social beliefs. As a whole, the issues do not directly relate to real-life situations but rather a more Barry-like nation-state as presented in Jennifer Government.

There are occasional "Easter Egg" issues, such as one that dealt with piracy on the high seas, released to everyone on International Talk Like a Pirate Day. Other special issues appear after nations have achieved certain population-growth requirements, allowing players to choose a leader, capital city and national religion.

The player's responses to issues (except for dismissals) affect the nation's status in three main factors: the level of Political Freedoms, Civil Rights and the strength of the Economy. Decisions can also affect other aspects of the nation, such as the crime rate, industry strength and public sector spending.

Based on the nation's personal, economic, and political freedoms, the nation is assigned to one of 27 government types, from Scandinavian Liberal Paradise and Capitalist Paradise to Corporate Police State and Psychotic Dictatorship.
