Clear an Attraction by yourself, and then challenge your family and friends—up to four people can play Multiplayer Attractions together!

Source: The Game Website.

118653.name: Nerf N-Strike Elite
118653.description:
It's up to you and the rest of the N-STRIKE team to blast him down once again. Jackal, a genius level NERF agent, has called the N-STRIKE ELITE back into action in this all-new adventure. In this mission, you will have the chance to build up your arsenal, improve your blasters and, most importantly, shoot bots.

Heralding the 40th anniversary year of Hasbro Inc.’s NERF brand, NERF “N-Strike” Elite comes bundled with a newly designed blue NERF SWITCH SHOT EX-3 blaster and attachable decoder lens that will deliver a blend of covert operation elements with over-the-top blasting missions.

Get in there and let the foam fly!

Source: The Publisher Website.

118654.name: Spirit Camera: The Cursed Memoir
118654.description:
A visceral 3D horror tale unfolds before your eyes.

The Spirit Camera: The Cursed Memoir game invites players to experience supernatural thrills they won’t soon forget, using the built-in camera functions and augmented-reality features of the Nintendo 3DS system. The game’s mysterious storyline involves a girl named Maya who has been hiding in the darkness of an old house, cursed by a malevolent woman in black. To free Maya from the curse, players must use the "diary of faces" -- a 16-page AR notebook included with the game -- to view ghostly images and interact with the world Maya is trapped in. The Nintendo 3DS system becomes the Camera Obscura in players%27 hands and is capable of revealing the supernatural and dispelling evil spirits. The lines between reality and fiction blur in this chilling horror adventure.

Features:
- The included “diary of faces” is a gateway into the game’s absorbing Story Mode. When viewed through the lenses of the Nintendo 3DS camera, each page of the book displays a variety of augmented-reality experiences.
- Some pages of the book come to life in the form of video segments that reveal past events and shed light on the game’s central mysterious storyline. Others appear to send spirits floating into players’ real-world surroundings. Some page even summons players to virtually enter a haunted house where Maya is hiding.
- Additional modes let players use the system’s camera in spooky ways. In Spirit Photography, they can take photos at their leisure and watch as haunting visions appear within the pictures. Spirit Check, lets them snap pictures of themselves and their friends to uncover the eerie spirits that surround them. In Spirit Challenge, they can put their own face or a friend’s face on a spirit and then battle it.
- Players can also use the notebook with their Nintendo 3DS system to face other challenges involving a mix of memory, hide-and-seek and other game play elements all with a supernatural twist.

Source: The Publisher Website.

118655.name: Samurai Sword Destiny
118655.description:
Samurai Sword Destiny is a character action game that will challenge players of all levels. You control of a deadly female samurai, Akane, with a single goal in mind: to find and bring her missing elder brother home.

On Akane's quest, she will encounter deadly ambushes, invade enemy castle rooftops, and square off against seemingly indomitable opponents. With the help of the dozens of upgrades available to enhance her fighting abilities, Akane just might have a fighting chance against the forces that stand in her path!

Source: The Publisher Website.

118656.name: Penultima
118656.description:
The game of Penultima is a chess variant that can accommodate 3-8 players. The recommended number of players for ideal play (as specified by the game designers themselves) is 5.

Only 2 of the players are actually referred to as "Players", with the rest being called "Spectators" - a misleading name considering that the "spectators" control the movement of the pieces as much as do the "players".

The game is played on the normal 8x8 checkered board with all of the normal piece figurines. The goal of the game is also the same: to check-mate the opponent's piece normally called the King.

At the beginning of the game, the 6 figure/piece types are allocated by some means between the spectators. The spectators take physical possession of all pieces of their type or types while they decide what rules shall govern their allowable movements, methods of capture, and any other consequences. These rules are kept secret from both players as well as all other spectators. The only constraint on the spectators' rules is that they must attempt to make the game playable. Once the spectators have made their decisions, they place the pieces on the board in the normal starting configuration (with some variation possible if the rules for a piece are incompatible with its normal starting position). Spectators then announce new names for their pieces. Names may be designed to try to help players guess the piece's rules.

In Penultima, black goes first. On a Player's turn, he or she can pick any of his or her pieces and move it anywhere on the board. Then the Spectator allocated to that piece will do one of three things:
1) They will allow the piece to remain where it is, declaring the move to be legal, but without consequence.
2) They may allow the piece to remain where it is, declaring the move legal, but will alter the positions of other pieces and/or remove pieces from play (and possibly say "check") to enact the consequence of the move. (As the game progresses, Players may learn the rules regarding capturing or moving other pieces and may act of these consequences themselves. If they act out a consequence incorrectly, the Spectator will correct the error.)
3) They will return the moved piece to its starting position, declaring the move illegal.

118657.name: Ram Racing
118657.description:
Nothing says "power" and "performance" like the legendary Ram brand. Now, you can climb behind the wheel of this iconic American truck and put it to the test! Choose from numerous exciting models, buckle in, rev the engine, and test the limits of this multiple "Truck of the Year" award winner.

Source: The Publisher Website.

118658.name: Junior Mystery Quest
118658.description:
When Professor MacNara and his daughter, Virginia, find an ancient galleon shipwrecked on a deserted beach, their lives are unknowingly changed forever. Once belonging to Christopher Columbus, the abandoned ship oddly appears to be in the exact condition it was over 500 years ago%21 But that is just the beginning of a series of curious events about to unfold.

Now it is up to you to unearth the curse%21

- Use detective skills to unmask the mystery%21
- Over 1,000 hidden objects and secrets to be discovered%21
- More than 50 fascinating levels to complete.
- 42 stunning tropical locations to visit.
- 12 exciting mini-games to unlock.

Source: The Publisher Website.

118659.name: Ace Driver Victory Lap
118659.description:
Ace Driver: Victory Lap Not Ace Driver 2: Victory Lap is a 3D racing arcade game released by Namco in 1996, featuring more tracks and Formula One cars than the predecessor: Ace Driver, in a modern futuristic setting.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ace Driver: Victory Lap", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118660.name: Air Combat 22
118660.description:
Air Combat 22 is an arcade game released by Namco in 1995 and the sequel to Air Combat in the Ace Combat series. It was named Air Combat "22" because it runs on Namco's Super System 22 hardware. It can render significantly better graphics, more polygons with sharper texture-mapping, running in higher resolution and at a higher framerate compared to the graphics capabilities of the original Sony PlayStation, the Sega Saturn and the Nintendo 64 video game systems, but much less than what the Sega Dreamcast can produce.

Source: Wikipedia, "Air Combat 22", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118662.name: Alpine Surfer
118662.description:
User Summary

Alpine Surfer is a snow skiing game from Namco. Was released after their Alpine Ski series.

This was a stand up single player game with a large screen and skiing props.

118663.name: Angler King
118663.description:
User Summary

Angler King is a stand up arcade game with a fishing type prop from Namco. Try to catch various fish and win trophies.

118664.name: Aqua Jet
118664.description:
User Summary

Aqua Jet is a sit down Jetski race game from Namco. Features a large color screen and sit down jet ski like seat. Drive around the track and take jumps.

118666.name: Aqua Rush
118666.description:
Aqua Rush is an upside down, Tetris-type arcade game released by Namco in 1999, set against aquatic backdrops. Aqua Rush differs from Tetris by adding to blocks, making them more difficult to place, if you want to change the shape of the block.

Source: Wikipedia, "Aqua Rush", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118667.name: Armadillo Racing
118667.description:
User Summary

Armadillo Racing is a bizzare racing game from Namco where players race armadillos against each other and time.

118668.name: Assassin
118668.description:
User Summary

In Assassin you play a black ops character shooting criminals in the city. Uses live acting film and animation in the story line.

118669.name: Silent Scope 3
118669.description:
Game Box

Silence The Enemy!
Silent Scope's intense sniping action returns for a 3rd round in an all-new game for the PlayStation 2 computer entertainment system! As the world's best sniper, prevent a terrorist organization from using cloning technology for global domination. Featuring expansive levels and diabolical bosses, it's time to silence the enemy threat. Silent Scope 3 delivers twice the gameplay by including the hit arcade game, Silent Scope Ex!

Features:
- Two complete games-- an all-new original game and the hit arcade game, Silent Scope EX
- Incorporates 3D sound technology to help find and target enemies
- High replay value with multiple endings and routs
- Unlock hidden stages and modes

118670.name: Assault Plus
118670.description:
Assault was followed by Assault Plus, an upgraded version in which the player could select the skill level before starting the game. The gameplay, graphics and sound effects are almost identical. This game was originally released only in Japan but was included as a bonus game on Namco Museum Vol. 4 along with Assault.

Source: Wikipedia, "Assault Plus", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118671.name: Attack Of The Zolgear
118671.description:
Attack Of The Zolgear (also known as Galaxian^3: Attack of the Zolgear) is a video game implemented as a conversion kit for Namco's "Theater 6" system, which was used for the 1994 arcade version of Galaxian 3 (which was originally a theme park attraction that debuted in 1990). A sequel to the aforementioned (which also had the subtitle of "Project Dragoon"), this six player game (gameplay for 6 at the same time in this huge 17' x 17' theater) never hit it big like its earlier version. This game used two laser disc players simultaneously for the outer space background, while computer generated graphics were overlaid on top.

Source: Wikipedia, "Attack Of The Zolgear", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118672.name: Bakuretsu Quiz Ma-Q Dai Bōken
118672.description:
Bakuretsu Quiz Ma-Q Dai Bōken (爆裂クイズ　魔Ｑ大冒険) (lit. Magical Q Great Adventure Exploding Quiz) is a quiz arcade game that was released by Namco in 1992 only in Japan.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bakuretsu Quiz Ma-Q Dai Bōken", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118673.name: Silent Scope 2: Dark Silhouette
118673.description:
Game Box

Twice the Skill, Twice the Thrill

Terrorists have stolen a poison gas missile and are about to unleash mass destruction on an unsuspecting country unless you and your partner can stop them. Take on exhilarating missions in majestic European environments ranging from downtown London to Swiss mountain ranges. With cooperative and competitive play, two players can take aim to see who is the best sniper%21

- All new pulse-pounding simultaneous two-player mode for cooperative or competitive play (using the i.LINK cable, sold separately)
- Four exciting modes of play including Story, Shooting Range, Duel, and Original
- Exclusive new modes, options, and levels created only for the console version
- Use innovative weapons, including the Thermal Vision Scoe and the X-Ray Scope
- Richly detailed graphics taken directly from the arcade version
- Multiple branching paths that increase replay value

118674.name: Big Buck Safari
118674.description:
User Summary

Big Buck Safari is a light shooter hunting game. Try to hit the best targets with perfect shots.

118675.name: Blazer
118675.description:
Blazer (ブレイザー) is an isometric perspective scrolling shooter arcade game that was released by Namco in 1987 only in Japan.

Source: Wikipedia, "Blazer (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118676.name: Boxy Boy
118676.description:
Boxy Boy, known in Japan as Soukoban Deluxe (倉庫番 DELUXE) is an arcade game released by Namco in 1990. It is based on the Sokoban game series by Thinking Rabbit.

Source: Wikipedia, "Boxy Boy", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118677.name: Bubble Trouble: Golly! Ghost! 2
118677.description:
Golly! Ghost! is an electro-mechanical/video game hybrid released by Namco in 1990.
There are two mounted guns on the arcade console. The gun on the left is colored blue and is nicknamed "Zip". The gun on the right is red and is nicknamed "Zap". The player(s) use the guns to shoot a specific amount of comical enemy ghosts before time runs out. This is a video ticket/redemption game. Players are rewarded based on their scores with tickets, which emerge from a ghost's mouth painted on the console.

Source: Wikipedia, "Golly! Ghost!", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118678.name: Xevious 3DG
118678.description:
User Summary

Xevious 3DG is a sequel to Xevious. Play cooperatively to shoot enemies, bomb targets and progress through levels.

118679.name: Sport-a-Crest
118679.description:
Place the 24 picture cards around the room where guests can easily see them. Players must look at the images and write down the sport suggested on their answer sheet.

The most correct answers, wins.

118680.name: The Mystery Cruise
118680.description:
The idea is to answer cryptic clues to place names, in order, and thus creating a cruise itinerary.

Place the clue cards around the room and give each guest an answer sheet. During the evening, guests should look at the cards and work out the place names.

The player who gets most right, wins.

A game in the Dainty Series

118681.name: Cobra The Arcade
118681.description:
User Summary

Cobra The Arcade is a light shooter game based on the Manga comic.

118682.name: Cosmo Gang The Puzzle
118682.description:
Cosmo Gang the Puzzle (コズモギャング・ザ・パズル?) is an arcade game that was released by Namco in 1992 . An adaptation of the game featuring Pac-Man characters was released in 1993 called Pac-Attack.

Source: Wikipedia, "Cosmo gang the puzzle", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118683.name: Triplex
118683.description:
Place the 24 Clue/Rhyme cards around the room where every guest can see them. On each card is a 4 line ryhme and this ditty will give a player three clues to a well known word. All the player has to do is to name that word and record it on their answer sheet.

The most correct answers, wins.

A game in the Dainty Series.

118685.name: Nyota: Longzhong Plan
118685.description:
“Nyota” is card game with theme of The Three Kingdoms in China.
In the game, players build States by cards that represent famous Warrior or Strategist or State and Army.
Charactor illustrations are cute, but the game has unique system of strategic and produced.

Game System

The player starts a game with some army corps markers and prestige markers equally.
First Player draw and face-up a card from top of deck, and the game progresses by making a bid for it. The deck is constructed according to a flow of the history in 3 seasons. Card type is three, by Warrior, Land, Event. The player gets a Warrior using prestige, gets Land by attacking it by army corps.
Warrior has special card effect and army corps marker. Land has VP, defence strength and army corps marker. The event card strikes the land of other users and affects the development of the game.
Warrior are Guan Yu, Zhuge Liang, Zhao Yun etc. Warrior Lu Bu appear in game by an event.
Player use prestige to get a Warrior, can thereby strengthen army corps. Using cooperated army corps, prestige is restored by catching Land. But the army corps which player used to obtain land cannot leave the Land for a while. Meanwhile, player must think protection of Land.The growth strategy is necessary, too.
Land of high VP and excellent Warrior appear late in the game. Therefore a bid is exciting.

118686.description:
The FIRST and the Only Sexy Game. It's the G game...It's the G gift
Are you sexy enough to attract customers in your brothel? But above all, you're pretty sexy face the penalties? Conquest erotic positions and collect money from customers! Classic game board with a penalty, drawings sexy and squares joker to spend a pleasant evening with friends. It is possible play in 2 or more people, individually or in pairs.

Objective:
The purpose of the game is to let in more customers in your own brothel so that you will earn more than the other players.

The players will form 2 groups: the first group will start from square number 1, the second group from square number 69. The board game is composed by empty squares (only with numbers), squares depicting erotic position and squares joker (with mouths). Every time that one player stops on a square with an erotic position he takes the corresponding card. Every time that the player stops on an empty square he will draw a penalty card. The winner is the player with the most money at the end of the game, or the one who has made the best performance.

The winner may choose a penalty for the other player or players. The box also contains a small billboard to take you on a journey, on weekends and holidays.

118687.description:
The baby elephants hide under the pedestals of the adult elephants, waiting to be found. Whoever finds the most baby elephants wins the game.

A children's game for 2 to 5 players, ages four and up. Players roll a die and try to locate cute platic elephants of the matching colour, hiding under little pedestal cups. A simple game of memory for children.

While this has a memory element, it is not another version of Memory. It uses a die to select what color elephant to attempt to locate under the pedestals. The pedestals are a scoring device. Players do not need to match pairs, just simply locate an elephant. If you don't locate a match, you grow the pool of elephants by one of your own pedestals. If you run out of pedestals, you're out of the game. Last player standing, or first player to successfully locate a set number of elephants, wins.
118687.name: Elephant Memo

118688.description:
In Sleepers, you are the leader of a resistance network operating in occupied France during World War II. Your primary mission is recruit a network of operatives working throughout the country; failing that, eliminating the other networks which are interfering with your own would allow you to build your network without interference.
When first recruited, agents are face-down and inactive (sleeper agents); later in the game, they may be activated to perform some task (active agents). The unqualified term agents applies to both active and sleeper agents. Tiles in hand or the bag are merely tiles, bribes and blackmail material which can be used to recruit agents.

EQUIPMENT


1 hexagonal board (61 hexes)
30 Agents for each player (different types)


OBJECTIVE

There are several ways to lose Sleepers:


Morale: a player is eliminated once ten of their agents are killed (the enemy spymaster flees the country).
Capture: a player is eliminated if they are surrounded by active militia (the enemy spymaster is captured).
Attrition: a player is eliminated if they cannot move (no more tiles AND no sleeper agents).


There are also several ways to win:


Success: make a line of active agents joining any two opposite sides of the board (your network covers the whole country).
Liberation: create a doomsday device by making a line of 5 active Scientists (you destroy Germany and free France).
Elimination: eliminate all other players.
118688.name: Sleepers

118689.name: Speq
118689.description:
Speq is a game for two or three players for the Shibumi set. It is an entry in the Shibumi Challenge.

Players take turns adding a ball of any colour to any empty board hole, or on any 2x2 platform provided that the tricolour triangle rule* is obeyed.

The game ends when the pyramid is full or no player can make any more moves, and is won by the player with the greatest number of balls of their colour in play (buried balls are counted).


Tricolour Triangle Rule: A ball can only be placed on a 2x2 platform if at least one side of the pyramid thus created forms an equilateral triangle with a ball of each colour at its tips. That is, at least one side of the pyramid must have a white, a black and a red ball at its corners. This must be true for every level down to the board level.

118691.name: Armor Powers
118691.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Sometimes heroes are made and not born, especially in the case of heroes who suit up in advanced armor, giving them capabilities to match the most powerful superhumans. Armor Powers looks at suits of power armor from weapons systems to defenses, movement and propulsion to utilities like communications and sensors, everything you need to create your own super-suits. In some cases, clothes really do make the (super-)man! This product is for Mutants & Masterminds Third Edition.

118692.name: Nekketsu! Beach Volley da yo: Kunio-kun
118692.description:
User Summary

Nekketsu! Beach Volley da yo: Kunio-kun is another game in the Nekketsu series. This is thier take on Volleyball with the standard add-ons like beating each other up and power shots.

118693.description:
Just as the Kinderspiel des Jahres-winning title Wer war's? was subsequently recreated as a portable non-electronic game, the Wer war's? follow-up Wer war's? Löst das Rätsel von Schräghausen! now has a portable version of its own: Wer war's? Das 2. Abenteuer - Mitbringspiel.

In this game, a goblin has cast a spell on all the children in town, locking them in their houses and – more importantly for the game – making them forget who owns the dog Bronco. Your goal is to find out which child owns Bronco so that the pooch can go home, get something to eat, and perhaps even wrangle a bit a ear-scritchin' from his young owner.

To set up the town, lay out ten houses in a four-row grid, with intersection tiles placed between the houses. Shuffle the children tokens, then set one aside and place one next to each house. Shuffle the ten keys face-down, and place one on each house.

On a turn, you first roll the die, which allows a peek at a key or a free move of Bronco to any house, or forces the clock to advance an hour or the intersections next to Bronco to rotate, possibly cutting off access to nearby houses. The player then moves Bronco to an adjacent house, if desired, then reveals any key on the board. If that key matches the house where Bronco is currently located, that child is freed and the number of suspects as to who owns Bronco drops by one; if the key doesn't match, return it face-down to its previous location and advance the clock by one hour.

The game ends one of two ways: Either the players free all of the children and therefore deduce which child remains as the owner of Bronco, or the clock hits 12; in this latter situation, the children can make one guess as to who owns Bronco, then reveal the hidden child. If correct, they win! If not, Bronco heads to the pound to live out the rest of his life filled with sorrow and self-loathing...

Reimplements:

Wer war's? Löst das Rätsel von Schräghausen!
118693.name: Wer war's? Das 2. Abenteuer: Mitbringspiel

118694.name: Ruby
118694.description:
Publisher's Description:
…Beyond Earth. Earth is a distant memory. Welcome to the Red System. …Beyond Humanity. The human race is finished. NuManity rules the Red Worlds. …Beyond the Body. NuMen ‘Dream’, Casting forth their intellects while cryogenically frozen to control distant Shells scattered through the Red Worlds, allowing them to work for the benefit of all NuManity and also to rid their minds of the vestiges of unwanted ‘human’ emotions. When they wake they remember nothing – a perfect system. …Beyond Dreams. But you are not the same. You are a Lucid, you remember every Dream vividly. Wracked by near-human emotions and faced with the full horrors of the Red System, only Unity can give you release, but at a price. You must work as an agent of Unity, freeing Obsessive Dreamers, battling Outsiders and eradicating the last dregs of humanity even as the rest of NuManity remains oblivious. Welcome to Ruby. Now close your eyes and sleep… www.fireruby.co.uk

boardgamehonor.22571: 2013 Spiel des Jahres Game of the Year Recommended

118695.description:
A dexterity game where players take turning loading wooden "stuff" onto a swaying wooden ship. Bottles, sailors, rats and other cargo are placed on the body of the ship and three yardarms that protrude from the mast.

Each player has the same set of objects and a hand of cards numbered 1-10. Choose one card, then reveal it simultaneously with the other players. On your turn you place any piece you want onto the numbered space you chose. If the cargo is not balanced, the ship will sway to and fro, and one or more items may fall off the ship. If you tip pieces off the ship, you can save them by catching them, but whatever you don't catch is added to the pieces you need to get rid of. The first player to get rid of all his objects wins the game.
118695.name: Riff Raff

boardgamehonor.22571: 2013 Spiel des Jahres Game of the Year Recommended

118697.description:
Hand aufs Herz is an interactive party game using game play similar to Trigger!, aka Declic!

Before the game begins, each player designates one hand to mean "true" and the other to mean "false". One player reads off a question, then everyone races to place her hand on the plastic heart in the middle of the table. Which hand? Well, that depends on the question! Each card has four questions that are linked in some way, so one question might ask about the relative height of all players, the second might be a negative question about shoe size, the third about the players' weight, and so on.

Players score – or lose – points depending on whether they answered the question correctly and which hand they used. The closer someone is to the bottom of the hand stack, the more points they'll score – or lose!
118697.name: Hand aufs Herz

boardgamehonor.21257: 2012 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "3 years and up" Nominee

118698.name: Flossen hoch!
118698.description:
Flossen hoch! is a kid's game about fishing with the players being penguins who waddle around looking for food. Heeeeeeeere, fishie, fishie fishie!

Each player has a penguin and a set of short to long fish. Before the game begins, players place the fish into slots in the ocean's surface, with only the heads being visible. Players roll a die and play simultaneously. When a color is rolled, players have to "catch" fish of the matching color as quickly as possible. If you pick empty fishbones instead, bad luck! When a fish is rolled, each player grabs his own fish; when a shark appears, each player must save all fish of her own color. Whenever you successfully grab a fish, the length of the fish determines how far your penguin moves forward on the race track.

118699.name: Streifen Toni
118699.description:
Streifen Toni, a card game based on Carmen Kleinert's Kinderspiel des Jahres-winning Da ist der Wurm drin, gives players the same goal as that game: Make your worm longer than anyone else's.

Each player starts the game with a worm head on the table and three random cards from a deck of worm section cards; the worm sections are in many colors and are of different lengths. Six other cards are placed face down on the table. On a turn, a player chooses one card from her hand, places it face down next to the others, then chooses any other card, reveals it, and adds it to her worm. The first card is placed directly next to the worm head; each additional section is placed on the marking stick of the previously card.

Once the deck of cards runs out, each player makes three further plays, then they compare worms to see which one bests the rest!

118701.name: Tanaris
118701.description:
user summary

This is a background sourcebook for Ruf des Warlock. It does not include everthing about the world Tanaris but includes many races and also classes and the religion, cults the magic. It also contains journey reports of the famous regions of tanaris with many rumors of legendary places. The book offers many stuff for GMs take make the world for the players more colorfull.

authors and artists are credited by Fantasy Games Bonn

118702.name: Tänzer im Sturm
118702.description:
publisher blurb

Tänzer im Sturm (storm dancer) is the 9th book of the universal adventure series Drachenland.

A magical city adventure full of nightmarish feeling in the winterly Khazzar. The mysterious death goes randomly through the deserted streets, the closer the adventures come the more good and evil melt.

118703.description:
Become part of a U.S. National Institution of the early 20th Century, as you build the routes and reputation of The Most Famous Train in the World: the 20th Century Limited. You are American rail luminaries, creating small independent lines to serve local cities. Plying your business acumen, you plan to sell these lines to larger companies. Of course, you wouldn’t be where you are today without knowing a thing or two about turning tricky situations to your advantage: You have a scheme in mind to get the big companies what they need, without necessarily having, shall we say, exclusive ownership of it….

20th Century Limited condenses the history the American railroad into a sixty-minute game. Players take on the roles of the great railway robber barons as they set up small railroads, turn them into larger rail lines, then sell them off and start all over again. The spread of the North American rail system can happen on your game table in about an hour as the network develops in a fashion similar to the historical model.

The game possesses the simple route-building mechanisms that were used in Transamerica. The placement of pieces is easy to understand, and this simple feature is livened up by the Rail Line cards that dictate the placement of rail segments to recreate the various historical railways of America. The second piece of the puzzle are the Demand cards that serve as a pseudo pick-up-and-deliver system. Players are able to choose what path suits them in the game. You can go for the fulfillment of demands or you can try to build the great rail lines that shaped America. Everything from the Santa Fe to Boston & Maine and many other memorable lines are represented, including the game's namesake: the New York Central Railroad.
118703.name: 20th Century Limited

118704.description:
Your goal in Speicherstadt Hamburg is to become a Senator in Hamburg during the late 19th century. To do this, you'll buy goods from the ships arriving in the harbor, repackaging some of them to create "donations" (i.e., bribes) to the Senate, while placing other goods onto the market in order to recoup funds needed for future purchases.

The Senate gives victory points for the best three donations. Which one is best? The Senate has different interests each round, which doesn't take into account the price of goods or how often those goods appear.

The players decide simultaneously which cards are gifted to the Senate, which sold at market, and which placed in the storehouse for later rounds. Therefore before the cards are revealed, you know neither whether your donation will succeed nor whether your goods will create enough income for the next round. You do have a lot of information as to which cards are in your opponents' hands, but you never know what they're going to do with them.

At game's end, players with the most money and filled storehouses receive extra points, and the player with the most points wins!
118704.name: Speicherstadt Hamburg

118705.description:
Ghost Blitz 2.0 – The new version of Ghost Blitz with different items – five wooden items sit on the table waiting to be caught: a white female ghost, a green frog, a grey bathtub, a blue hairbrush, and a red bath towel. Each card in the deck shows pictures of two objects, with one or both objects colored the wrong way. With all players playing at the same time, someone reveals a card, then players grab for the "right" object – but which object is right?


If one object is colored correctly – say, a green bathtub and a red rug – then players need to grab that correctly colored object.



If both objects are colored incorrectly – say, a green bathtub and a red ghost – then you look for the object and color not represented among the four details shown. In this case you see green, red, ghost and bathtub, so players need to grab the blue brush.


The new version of Ghost Blitz functions similarly to the original but includes the following new rules:
- If the frog appears, you have to call out the item.
- If the frog or the other item is in its original colour, you have to call out the correct item in a foreign language.
- If the towel appears on a card, the item of the towel`s colour is the one to grab for.

The first player to grab the correct object keeps the card, then reveals the next card from the deck. If a player grabs the wrong object, she must discard one card previously collected. Once the card deck runs out, the game ends and whoever has collected the most cards wins!
118705.name: Geistesblitz 2.0

118706.name: Envoyer (Issue 55 - May 2001)
118706.description: This isse has its main focus in Shadowrun including an adventure, reviws and a short story.

118707.name: Envoyer (Issue 56 - Jun 2001)
118707.description: This issue contains the DSA adventure "Der Mörder von Schratmoor"

118708.name: Envoyer (Issue 58 - Aug 2001)
118708.description: This issue contains a pirate roleplay idea on basis of cthulhu. And a setting "Bestienherz".

118709.name: Hex-A-Gon
118709.description:
Players in Hex-A-Gon want to seize as many knights as possible, and whoever seizes the most knights wins.

To set up the game, lay out the hexagonal game board, which is covered with a hex-shaped pattern of hexagons with five hexes per side, then place one knight on each space of the game board other than the center hex. (P.S. Hex!)

On a turn, a player chooses one knight on the game board, then jumps one or more knights with it in succession. When a knight jumps, it lands on one of the three hexes (if empty) on the opposite side of the knight jumped, then the player captures the jumped knight, leaving an empty space that can be landed in during future jumps – even during that same turn. A player must make at least one jump, if possible, on her turn, but she is not compelled to make more than one. The game ends once no more jumps are possible.

Hex-A-Gon includes rules for solitaire play, as well as variants that randomly hide "treasures" – colored wooden bits – inside some of the knights prior to the start of the game. Depending on the variant rules used, these treasures provide a player with positive or negative points, allow a player to freeze knights and prevent them from being captured, or blasts knights away from the treasure.

118710.name: Envoyer (Issue 59 - Sep 2001)
118710.description: This issue contains an adventure "Hinderoths Fall" and an article about (sexual) relationship of heroes in roleplay.

118711.name: Envoyer (Issue 60 - Oct 2001)
118711.description:
This issue contains the adventure "Mächte des Wahnsinns" and the 2nd part of the short story "Der Drachentöter" and an interview about the upcomming 4th edition of DSA.

The cover has a mistake with the Index number (10), but this is number 60.

118712.name: Envoyer (Issue 63 - Jan 2002)
118712.description: This issue contains an adventure for DSA "Rose"

118713.description:
In Peek-a-Boo!, three children have placed sheets on their heads to pretend that they're ghosts – but unknown to them a real ghost has joined their playtime! It's up to you to determine under which sheet the real spirit is hiding as well as which color candle it's holding. To do this, players must make use of the mirrors in the castle surrounding the figures as everyone knows that true spirits don't cast a reflection...

To set up for the game, each player receives a search tile showing a symbol, and 16 candle chips (each showing one of four colors and one of four symbols) are mixed and placed facedown on the spaces on the circular track. The mechanical doohickey in the game board – which lowers mirrors out of sight when one of the ghosts is used to crank a gear in the board – is set up. You secretly place one of the four colored candles in each ghost, then set them on the game board.

On a turn, you roll the die. If you roll a number, you move a ghost of your choice the number of spaces indicated to try to land on a candle chip. If you do land on one, you reveal it, keeping the chip if it shows your symbol and leaving it faceup on the board otherwise. If you roll a ghost, you can conduct a mirror test, take a joker move, or do both. For the mirror test, you take one of the ghosts, place it in the center of the game board, then crank the gear (as each ghost has a coglike thing beneath it). If the mirrors disappear, you've found the real ghost! If not, you'll see the ghost reflected in a mirror and the angle of the mirror allows you to see the candle color; announce this color to all players. For a joker move, you move a ghost to any space of your choice to try to collect the chip on it.

Once you have all four of your chips, you immediately test a ghost of your choice to see whether the mirrors fall. If they do, you need to then name the color of candle it holds. If you fail either test, you're out of the game and play continues until the next player tests a ghost. If you succeed, you've revealed the real ghost and win!
118713.name: Peek-a-Boo!

118714.name: Envoyer (Issue 64 - Feb 2002)
118714.description: This issue contains an adventure / scenario for Shadowrun. And the 1st part of a comic special.

118715.name: Scions LARP Rulebook (2nd Edition)
118715.description:
User Summary:

Rulebook for the Scions LARP game.

118717.name: JumpStart SpyMasters: Unmask the Prankster
118717.description:
A mysterious villain called the Prankster is causing out-of-control weirdness everywhere! You've been recruited to join the secret Spy Masters team to stamp out the trouble. Get to work saving the day by using your knowledge of history, geography, math, and language arts to stop the Prankster, as you wield cutting-edge gadgets to halt his slick tricks and neutralize his army of trouble-making robots. Navigate your way through 3D worlds of ancient cities, abandoned amusement parks, a robot factory, and more.

Source: The Publisher Website.

118718.name: Minesweeper of Wizard
118718.description:
"Minesweeper of Wizard has a fantastic eye candy graphic you are looking for.
LOVE RETRO GAMES like minesweeper? But no more grey squares on the grid please.
Play the classic game that is reborn with more entertaining elements; a story, eye candy graphics and social networking features for the new generation and classic gamers.
The numbers on the square indicates how many mines are around the square.Mark the square most likely to have a mine. Reveal the square that has numbers and the lands, not the mines."

Source: The Game Website.

118719.name: Hidden Objects: Little Red Ridding Hood
118719.description:
User Summary

Hidden Objects - Little Red Ridding Hood is a puzzle game in which you have to find out all the hidden objects indicated in the top panel. This is a simple game, there are six hidden objects in each picture and the objects vary each time you play.

118720.name: Chicken Balls
118720.description:
"You play Crash, the BRAVEST chicken this side of New Mexico. It’s the summer of 1947, you’ve just come back from the war and had hoped to hang up your flight cap for good. When a UFO crash lands just outside the nearby town of Roswell you knew you’d have to take to the skies one more time."

Source: The Developer Website.

118721.name: Math Blaster in the Prime Adventure
118721.description:
It's nearing graduation time at the Blaster Corps Academy, but something terrible has happened. Aimee, the legendary AI program who helped save the universe with the original Blaster, and helped create the Blaster academy, is missing! There is a new program, Eemia, causing trouble throughout the known universe and it's up to you to complete your graduation by stopping Eemia, rescuing Aimee and restoring order to the galaxy.

The award-winning PC edutainment series, Math Blaster in the Prime Adventure, is blasting its way on to the Nintendo DS with an all-new adventure. Put your math skills to the ultimate test in this action-packed adventure that adds up to total fun!

- Use the Touch Screen to solve math problems in an array of action-based games.
- Challenge yourself with 3 difficulty modes that ADD up to frenzied fun!
- Play against up to 3 friends and challenge their math and gameplay skills in single card or multi card play with the Multiplayer Battle Mode
- Save the galaxy in 20 Adventure Mode levels or play any game you choose, arcade-style, in Challenge Mode
- Track your high scores in Adventure and Challenge Modes
- Master your math skills and increase your speed and accuracy

Source: The Publisher Website.

118722.name: Envoyer (Issue 65 - Mar 2002)
118722.description: This issue contains a shadowrun scenario: "Aus alten Zeiten".

118723.name: Envoyer (Issue 66 - Apr 2002)
118723.description: This issue contains the adventure "Das Orakel von H'Rabaal"

118724.name: Sauv' Tipsy
118724.description:
Kind of similar game to Operation.
The goal of the game is to take care of the baby dog!

Each player has five cards to play and take care to Tipsy, the dog without hurting him, who then barks in pain if the wrong treatment has done!

First player who has discarded all of its treatments.
At the end of the game, the puppy is saved: he wakes up and barks!

118725.name: Dancing Eyes
118725.description:
User Summary

Dancing Eyes is a puzzle game where you draw around boxes on girls to remove their clothes. Avoid bugs that are after you to survive.

118726.name: Dangerous Seed
118726.description:
Dangerous Seed (デンジャラスシード) is a vertical scrolling shooter arcade game that was released by Namco in 1989 only in Japan. In 1990, a Sega Mega Drive version was also developed and released only in Japan.
The player assumed control of three separate ships operated by three separate pilots: Alpha ship is piloted by Yugo Tyrone, Beta ship is piloted by Belle Vogato, and Gamma ship is piloted by Kenny Crawford. Each ship had a different firing pattern that the player could switch between when the ships were formed together as The Moon Diver. Their mission is to quell an alien invasion spanning all of the Milky Way and destroy the aliens' headquarters: the Danger Seed.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dangerous Seed", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118727.name: Derby Quiz: My Dream Horse
118727.description:
User Summary

Derby Quiz - My Dream Horse is a trivia game. Answer questions right to advance your horse in the race. Get enough correct answers to win.

118728.name: Envoyer (Issue 68 - Jun 2002)
118728.description: This issue contains an adventure for Paranoia: "Gefahr in Sektor T-O-D"

118729.name: Envoyer (Issue 69 - Jul 2002)
118729.description: This issue contains 2 adventures: 1. "Im Auftrag des Todes", 2. "Der Dungeon"

118730.name: Night's Watch

rpghonor.23131: 2013 Ennie for Best Aid/Accessory - Gold Winner

rpg.701: A Song of Ice and Fire Roleplaying

118730.description:
From the back cover:

Though the Great Houses and their vassals play the eternal Game of Thrones, there are some who do not. The men of the Night's Watch guard the immense and icy Wall, built in the ancient days of Westeros to hold back the terrible things of the Long Night. Once a mighty cohort of brave knights and lords who gave up everything to protect the Seven Kingdoms from the predators of the Far North, the Night's Watch is now a rag-tag band of thieves, murderers, and those who ran afoul of the political machinations of their enemies. When the wildlings stir on the other side of the Wall, and the cold winds rise once more, will they be enough to save Westeros? Night's Watch gives you everything you need to add this once noble order to your A Song of Ice and Fire Roleplaying chronicle. It includes rules for playing men of the Night's Watch and wildlings alike, as well as new information about the mysterious Others. Pray, men of the green lands, for Winter is Coming!

118731.name: Envoyer (Issue 70 - Aug 2002)
118731.description:
This issue contains an interview with Fanpro about Shadowrun.
This issue included a complete "Quick Start" for Cthulhu with core rules, sheets and a short adventure. (It can be seperateted from the issue (32 pages with own index). Cthulhu für Einsteiger (The version with "Am Rande der Finsternis")

118732.description:
It is the 1920s, a time of much industrial building and growth. In Titans of Industry, you must invest in building factories and businesses in order to produce goods and sell them to gain victory points (VPs). Game play involves a delicate balance of money, production, and goals. The person who can best manage his buildings and meet his goals in seven years will win.

Each player starts the game with four workers and $6,000. Every turn, players first buy buildings, then place workers on those buildings or on the board. Factories allow you to produce goods, while Businesses allow you to sell those goods for money or VPs. A good player needs to balance production and sales, and encourage other players to sell with them to maximize sales. Board elements allow players to take advantage of bonuses, such as extra production, building improvements, and Corporate Strategy cards. Corporate Strategy cards help give players additional goals and direction, by specifying additional ways to gain victory points.

Three times during the game – years 1923, 1925, and 1927 – upkeep will be due, and players must pay to maintain their buildings, or will need to take out loans. Players will need to sell enough goods before then to have enough money to cover the costs, as loans are worth negative victory points at the end of the game. After year 1927, whoever has the most victory points from combined sales, buildings, and Corporate Strategy cards wins the game.

Titans of Industry, which allows 3-6 players and plays in approximately 20-25 minutes per player, is a rich worker-placement/resource-management Euro-style game.
118732.name: Titans of Industry

118733.name: Blood Drive
118733.description:
Back of Game Box

Brains, Stains and Automobiles!

Welcome to the most ruthless modern-day gladiator arena this world has ever known. This is the entertainment sport for a twisted new age, and you are the franchise player. With battle-hardened, heavily armored vehicles and your kill-or-be-killed instinct as your only weapons, you'll fight for your life in horrific vehicle combat and against a seemingly endless mass of blood-thirsty zombies. Your combat driving and survival skills will determineyour fate as you brutally try to send both the living and undead straight to hell one bloody tire tread at a time.


Badass cars are the starts - experience gruesome motorized combat!



Battle through the most grisly and horrific tournaments ever televised!



Take this ultimate orgy of violence online, in a multiplayer bloodbath!

118734.name: Zone Twelve
118734.description:
Zone Twelve is a dice game for 3-6 players with some elements of gambling and lots of luck.

A game consists of 5 rounds plus one bonus round. One game takes about 15 minutes to play.

On each turn a player rolls the three dice and tries to get the dice to add up to 12. Two of the dice are 0-5 (one side is labeled "Zone") while the other die is 2-5 with a side labeled "Zone Wild", which can be any number 0-6.

In the bonus round, each player rolls a green die and wins or loses chips based on an earlier bet. This die has special sides of W, W 1/2, L, L 1/2.

At the end of the game, players count up their chip totals. The instructions state that 4 games should be played and the person with the highest cumulative chip total be declared the winner.

118735.description:
Hobby Store League Promo Series 1

Name: Temporal Vortex
Type: Special
FLIP: Set this card aside and replace it.
Effect: When spending XP to gain cards, players may gain cards from the top 9 cards of the starbase discard area as though it were in the starbase search area. Remove this card from the game at the start of the turn of the p(l)ayer that flipped it. [NOTE: Card text is missing "l" in "player" as indicated above in parenthesis.]

Currently available through BoardGameGeek's Promo Store (in a 3-card set with Star Trek Deck Building Game: Thomas Riker Promo and Star Trek Deck Building Game: Jean-Luc Picard Promo.)
118735.name: Star Trek Deck Building Game: Temporal Vortex Promo

98242.name: Star Trek Deck Building Game: The Next Generation

118736.description:
Hobby Store League Promo Series 1

Name: Thomas Riker
Type: Character
Characteristics: Federation | Human | Male | Lieutenant
Effect: If this card is played during an Event or battle, draw 1 card. If you completed a Mission or Event this turn, you get +3 XP.

Stats: +2 | +3 | - | - |

Currently available through BoardGameGeek's Promo Store (in a 3-card set with Star Trek Deck Building Game: Temporal Vortex Promo and Star Trek Deck Building Game: Jean-Luc Picard Promo.)
118736.name: Star Trek Deck Building Game: Thomas Riker Promo

98242.name: Star Trek Deck Building Game: The Next Generation

118737.description:
Hobby Store League Promo Series 1

Name: Jean-Luc Picard
Cost: 5
Type: Character
Characteristics: Federation | Human | Male | Ensign
Effect: During this turn, you may discard this card. If you do, you get +2 XP.
During this turn, you may trash this card. If you do, gain a Jean-Luc Picard from starbase.
Stats: +2 | +2 | - | - |

Currently available through BoardGameGeek's Promo Store (in a 3-card set with Star Trek Deck Building Game: Temporal Vortex Promo and Star Trek Deck Building Game: Thomas Riker Promo.)
118737.name: Star Trek Deck Building Game: Jean-Luc Picard Promo

98242.name: Star Trek Deck Building Game: The Next Generation

118738.name: Unstoppable Gorg
118738.description:
DANGER! Earth is under attack from a vast armada of flying saucers. Only you can stop the invasion of these relentless alien monsters - don't let a single one through!

Get ready for a revolution in tower defense that will send you spinning. Defend the solar system by sending satellites into orbit around planets, moons and space stations. Create the perfect defense by rotating orbits to move your satellites into the best positions.

Do you have what it takes to defeat the Gorg and save the solar system? Find out in more than 40 levels of thrilling tower defense action inspired by classic sci-fi films from the 1950s.

Source: The Publisher Website.

118739.name: Dirt Dash
118739.description:
User Summary

Dirt Dash is an off-road driving game. Drive your four wheel over dirt tracks. Race against time and other drivers.

118740.name: Mall of the Deads
118740.description:
This is a PNP Zombie survival game for 2-6 players. The setting is in a Mall. Players can choose from 12 familiar characters. Each character has his/her own objectives to get besides surviving. For example, a stunt man must find his daughter & a vaccine while a high school girl needs to find her brother. Each character earns a certain victory points if he/she got the right people/item AND arrived at the security room OR exit to parking lot. However, the security room & the exit door are both locked. You must get the key/keycard before others getting them.

Players will meet new survivors in the mall during exploration. You may ask them to join you by giving items they want. You earn extra VPs by escorting them to safety. However, food, weapons & ammo are limited. Players must compete with each other for food & ammo while sharing with his partner survivors.

Beside the brainless zombies, there are other hostile enemies like terrorists, psychopaths & mystic cultists. So players may also need to co-operate with each other to survive against the hordes of enemies. You have to plan when to co-operate & when to betray the other players. Players with most VPs at game end wins.

118741.name: Dirt Fox
118741.description:
Dirt Fox (ダートフォックス Daato Fokkusu) is a racing arcade game that was released by Namco in 1989 only in Japan.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dirt Fox", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118742.name: Downhill Bikers
118742.description:
User Summary

Downhill Bikers is a downhill mountain bike racing game. Up to four players can sit and play. Seating similar to mountain bikes.

118743.name: Driver's Eyes
118743.description:
Namco Driver's Eyes is a first-person Formula One simulator on the namco system 21 hardware released in 1990. The game has a pseudo-panoramic view using three C.R.T. screens; the player would sit in a then realistic formula one car cockpit with L.C.D. instruments. The game starts with the player selecting either "easy drive" or "technical drive" (this is an explanation of what happens after the player has made his/her selection) when selection was made the screen would show a 3d model of a formula one car with a V8 engine being placed into the engine bay then the body work gliding down. As this happens the camera view changes and reveals a sign saying "BRAKES ON" when the sign is lifted the race starts.

Source: Wikipedia, "Driver's Eyes", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118744.name: Dunk Mania
118744.description:
User Summary

Dunk Mania is a 2 on 2 basketball game from Namco. Follows standard short court rules.

118745.name: Exbania
118745.description:
User Summary

Exbania is a fighting game from Namco in which up to four players can fight each other and other enemies. It is similar to Bomberman in portions of its game play

118746.name: Family Bowl
118746.description:
User Summary

Family Bowl is a bowling game where you roll a real ball to knock down virtual pins.

118747.name: Fighter & Attacker
118747.description:
Fighter & Attacker (original Japanese title: F/A) is a vertical scrolling shooter arcade game that was released by Namco in 1992.
Unlike most vertical scrolling shooters, which limit the player to a single ship design with no chance to choose a different one; Fighter & Attacker allows the player to choose from a squadron of 16 different fighter jets from many different countries' air forces. The types of guns, secondary weapons and amount of ammo differ from jet to jet, with the F-117A being considered the fighter jet with the best amount of success.

Source: Wikipedia, "Fighter & Attacker", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118748.name: Final Furlong
118748.description:
Final Furlong is a horse racing game for the Namco System 23. The original was developed by Namco.

Source: Wikipedia, "Final Furlong", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118749.name: Final Lap
118749.description:
Final Lap is a racing video game produced by Namco,[1] and released by Atari Games for the United States in 1987. It was the unofficial sequel to the popular Pole Position games.[citation needed]
In many ways this game can be considered Pole Position 3, as it improved upon its original formula and bears much similarity to its predecessor.

Source: Wikipedia, "Final Lap", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118750.name: Final Lap 2
118750.description:
al Lap 2, as the name suggests, is the sequel to Final Lap, released by Namco in 1990.

Source: Wikipedia, "Final Lap 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118751.name: Final Lap 3
118751.description:
Final Lap 3, as the name suggests, is the third title in the Final Lap series, released by Namco in 1992.

Source: Wikipedia, "Final Lap 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118752.name: Final Lap R
118752.description:
User Summary

Final Lap R is another sequel in the Final Lap racing series by Namco.

118753.name: Final Lap UR
118753.description:
User Summary

Final Lap UR is another racing game from Namco in the Final Lap Series. Race against other drivers to win the race.

118754.name: Footbal Power
118754.description:
User Summary

Footbal Power is a football game from Namco. Play professional teams using standard football rules.

118755.name: Four Trax
118755.description:
Four Trax is an arcade game that was released by Namco in 1989. It is a Quad bike based racing game which is between one and eight players with four linked cabinets.

Source: Wikipedia, "Four Trax", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118757.name: Great Sluggers
118757.description:
User Summary

Great Sluggers is a head to head baseball game from Namco. Get as many runs as possible to beat your opponent.

118758.name: Guitar Jam
118758.description:
User Summary

Guitar Jam is a guitar game from Namco released in Japan. Play guitars Rock star style to score points.

118759.name: Gunmen Wars
118759.description:
User Summary

Gunmen Wars is an interesting shooter where you can play 2 on 2 and shoot each other to score points.

118760.name: Dis ton mot
118760.description:
"Say your word!" in English.
There are 48 cards with a letter. The cards are dealt among the players, face down in front of them.
In his turn, the active player will return the top card of his pack and place it face up on the table. Then he will propose, in less than a minute, a word with the letter of the card. He look at his cards to find other letters for this word, if one letter still missing, he moves to the next player and look at his cards for this latter. If any other player has a valid proposal, the unfortunate active player must not only take the card he has returned, but all the cards on the table of previous rounds and puts these on the point deck!

In the end, when all the cards were played, the game ends, there are points on the letters we have collected, and whoever has the least is declared "Grand Winner"!

118761.name: Whale's Voyage
118761.description:
User Summary

Whale's Voyage is a mixture of roleplaying game, space simulation and adventure. A big part of the game is the interstellar trading and improvement of the ship, the Whale. Another important part takes place on the planets and uses a first person view with 90 degree steps as it was often used in roleplaying games in that era.

118762.name: Expresso
118762.description:
Each card of 'Expresso' contains five words on the front and five words on the back of the same figure of speech.

At the beginning of the game, the 'Expresso' cards are mixed and then placed in the center of the table. Players are divided into two teams of similar size on both sides. The starting player chooses one of five colors that correspond to words that will be played throughout the game: blue, green, pink, brown, or purple. He draws a card from under the package that held vertically between the thumb and forefinger so that both teams only see one side from the the card.

Teams must find the word of the opposite team. All players are so many proposals out loud as they want and when any player has the word that is written on the other side of the card, he wins and gets the card.

The first player or the first team to get seven cards wins the round. Obtained two rounds wins the game.

118763.name: MS Saga: A New Dawn
118763.description:
MS Saga: A New Dawn (Gundam True Odyssey 失われしGの伝説, Ushinawareshi G no Densetsu?, "The Legend of the Lost G"), is a role-playing game for the PlayStation 2 console based on the Gundam franchise. The game was designed to be accessible to a general audience unfamiliar with Gundam. The "MS" in the title refers to the iconic Mobile Suit that features in the series.

Source: Wikipedia, "MS Saga: A New Dawn", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

118764.name: L'Intrus
118764.description:
"Intruder" in English.
There are 52 cards in this game and 4 words on each card.
Object of the game is to find one of the four word as a intruder who doesn't fit with other 3 words.

At the beginning of the game, some cards are distributed to players. Each card contains 6 sets of 4 words. In his turn, the player reads aloud the first set from the card. All other players try to find intruder before the others but to score a point we must not only give the intruder but also give good explanation why this word doesn't fit to set.
At the end, the player who scores the most points wins the game.

Example:
4 countries - Argentina, Peru, Brazil, Bolivia
These are Spanish-speaking countries except Brazil which is Portuguese.

118765.name: Vollpension
118765.description:
user summary

Shortcut 01
up to 7 heroes, duration 6 hours

This is an free german adventure for Space Gothic. The charcters had a bad accident in a far away and lonesome region. They had to find help ... but what they find is everything else than helpfull

118766.name: Free Fate
118766.description:
from the introduction page of the PDF

"Free FATE is your gateway to exciting adventures, suspenseful tales and thrilling action! This guide helps you and your friends to tell interactive stories, otherwise known as a roleplaying game. The Free FATE rules are a cut down & condensed version of the FATE System (Fantastic Adventures in Tabletop Entertainment), and are intended to appeal to gamers who prefer uncomplicated rules and to act as an introduction to the full system.
The FATE system was developed by Robert Donoghue and Fred Hicks of Evil Hat Productions, and based upon the Fudge System of Grey Ghost
Press."

118767.name: Oups ! mon prénom...
118767.description:
"Oops, my name ..." in English.

Word game based on French words.
In his turn player reads from his card a questions, and other players must find a name as an answer to score a point and get this card.

When there are no more cards in the hands of players, the
player who has got the most card in fron of him is the winner.

Example:
Mr. & Mrs. utan have a son .... Laurent!
His name is ... Laurent utan (sounds like the orangutan in French).

118768.name: C Koa
118768.description:
The object is to guess a thing or an object using your 5 senses.

There are 3 steps to guess:
1) You choose the direction you want to know the index (eg smell).
2) You become aware of the index (eg I feel good sea air).
3) You are attempting a proposal on the matter to be discovered (eg a hook).

If the answer is correct, you win the card as a point. If the answer is wrong, choose another step to guess and so on. But beware, once an index revealed, all players can make a proposal. You must be the smartest and fastest!

118769.name: Ego
118769.description:
Each "Ego" card displays 4 situations and 4 attitudes for each situation to choose..

In his turn player chooses a card and reads aloud the situation in which it is located and the four attitudes that are offered to A, B, C and D. He chooses an attitude for this situation for him.
All other players try to guess together what the reader would have done in this situation and choose one attitude (A,B,C,D)
If they guess the correct attitude the current player had chosen then the player keeps the card and the place before him. If the choice is different, the player loses this card.

When all the 'ego' cards was used, the game is over. The winner is the player with the most points (cards).

EGO is primarily a game of communication. It can be played in a more free, not counting the points. The player is faced with a situation must secretly choose his attitude and sincerely address this situation (among the options set out on his map 'ego'). He has no interest in lying. Other players will then guess what he or she would do in this situation, given their own idea of ​​the person. Finally, the answers are revealed and compared. The comments will then rife about the personality of sometimes surprising each other.

118770.name: Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War – Tau Edition
118770.description:
User Summary

The "Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War: Tau Edition"not only features both the award winning "Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War - Game of the Year" edition, but also the expansion "Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War - Dark Crusade".

As a special, this bundle also contains a limited metal coin, sporting the "Dawn of War" logo on one side, and a Tau symbol on the other side.

118771.name: Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War – Sisters of Battle Edition
118771.description:
User Summary

The "Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War: Sisters of Battle Edition" not only features both the award winning "Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War - Game of the Year" edition, but also the expansion "Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War - Soulstorm".

As a special, this bundle also contains a limited key chain, sporting the "Inquisition" symbol on one of it's sides.

118772.name: Abwärts
118772.description:
user summary

Shortcut 02

This is a short adventure for Space Gothic, this can be used while the heroes leave a very high complex with the elevator. This adventure was made for up to 9 heroes and last about 1 hour. Useable in most city advnetures, also with other RPGs

118773.name: Exit: Sing Sing
118773.description:
You are a prisoner of the Sing Sing prison and your goal is to be first to break away.

All players start from the cell in the center of the plate and try to win one of four outputs located at the four corners of the plate.

In his turn player draws a tile from the bag without looking and lays it on the board before placing his pawn onto it. So all players try to build their own path to the exit.

But the route is convoluted and depends on the draw: unexpected directions. or different barriers: bars, fence, wall, reinforced door. They can also pick the tools they need to overcome these obstacles: lime, squeezed, chord and key.

It's a game of chance but where interactivity between players and tactics come in.

118774.name: David Beckham Soccer
118774.description:
From the back of the box:

David Beckham Soccer is an exciting fast paced soccer game featuring over 200 teams and a vast array of competitions and options. Also included is the unique "train with Beckham" training facility where you can practice your skills with tests set for you by David himself!

118775.name: Force 21
118775.description:
From the back of the box:

The year is 2012.

Conventional Chinese forces invade Kazakhstan, commandeering natural resources to sustain its recent economic boom.
The Unity States, in defense of the Russia/Kazakh border, intends to contain China.
Attempts at diplomacy fail, and the conflict quickly escalates into World War III.

You are the machine of war.

As an elite Armored Commander, you will lead the massive Chinese offensive or the technologically advanced US force.

Choose sides.

118776.description:
Your small island is peaceful and prosperous – so prosperous that your tribe has grown beyond its ability to sustain you! Fortunately, being a peaceful people you have chosen not to fight over what little there is. Instead, you set out in your seagoing Wa’a (canoe) to fish and gather crops from the many nearby islands. The fertility goddess Haumea has blessed these islands, and they are rich with fruits, vegetables, and spices. It is a matter of pride to collect the finest harvest for the village. Can you win the race against time and the sea, and prove that you are the best gatherer of all?

In Tahiti the goal is to collect crops (coconuts, taro, bananas, spice) and fish from the surrounding islands to score points with bonuses for making full sets and acquiring the most of their family favorites which are hidden from the other players.

The game starts off with just your home island and its immediate neighboring islands. Players build up the archipelago of fertile islands with the guidance of Haumea for the first part of the game until all islands are in play. Players seed the islands each turn giving them some control over where crops replenish. Once the archipelago is formed, the late season is triggered when crops start becoming scarce, with players occasionally stopping an island from producing altogether. Although the late season may not be as good for crops, fishing becomes easier with bonuses given to the waters around some of the islands.
During all this the players travel by Wa’a from island to island using action points to collect the crops they want or can get to before the others take them. As the Wa’a fills, it becomes slower limiting the number of actions they have. There are also treacherous reefs around the islands that require you go around them or risk losing some of the crops aboard your Wa’a. At the end of the year, the one who most efficiently gathers food for their family wins.
118776.name: Tahiti

118777.name: Proteus (1st Edition)
118777.description:
-An excerpt from the PROTEUS Manual

Welcome to the last bastion of humanity, where Earth is but a distant memory. This world is known as Ad Tair. Here humanity is but one of many species struggling to survive. Races and civilizations are isolated from one another and most of the planet?s technology has been wiped out in a single cataclysmic event. The devastating effects of that horrible accident can still be seen. A dark billowing mass of swirling fog is all that can be seen of what was once Mt. McKenna. A secret project based there was responsible. Now another project is entering a critical phase. This long-forgotten secret could mean the destruction of this world ? or its salvation. The name of the project is PROTEUS.

118778.name: Uno: Patriots
118778.description:
Another UNO variation, this time featuring pictures of the 2007 New England Patriots.

WHAT MAKES THIS DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO: The "Acquisition" card, with a picture of Randy Moss. Using this card means you take a card from your hand and declare what card you want. If any player has it, they must exchange it for the card you have offered.

Comes in a plastic football-helmet shaped case.

118779.name: Grabbit!
118779.description:
All players start with 8 cards.
On your turn, you roll the dice to see if you have to give, take or lose cards of the appropriate character.
At random times, the board will 'laugh' & you must then grab one of the highlighted character figures.
Any players that succeed in this will then score the matching cards in their hand.
Play to an agreed upon number of 'grabs'

118780.name: Envoyer (Issue 71 - Sep 2002)
118780.description: This issue contains an adventure for shadowrun: "Bandenspiel"

118781.name: Envoyer (Issue 72 - Oct 2002)
118781.description: This issue contains an adventure for DSA "Alpträume"

118782.name: Envoyer (Issue 73 - Nov 2002)
118782.description: This issue contains the second part of the DSA adventure "Alpträume"

118783.name: Envoyer (Issue 74 - Dec 2002)
118783.description: This issue contains a cyberpunk 2020 adventure "Der Hauptgewinn"
